Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2018
ChromaGun é um jogo com uma atmosfera bem semelhante ao famoso Portal, composto principalmente de puzzles, onde se usa uma arma que atira tinta, tal tinta serve para atrair os "WorkerDroids", Droids com um formato esferico, que variam de ativo/ofensivo (Com espinhos) e inativos/inofensivos (sem espinhos), os mesmos são atraídos por cores semelhantes, ou seja, se ele é azul uma parede azul ira atraí-lo e etc...

No jogo há 8 cores:

As primárias: Azul, vermelho e amarelo
As secundárias ( Obtidas com a combinação das primárias): Roxo, verde e laranja
E as cores que não Atraem: Branco e castanho/preto ( resultante de misturar uma secundária com uma cor primária)

Em relação a dificuldade, ela aumenta com o decorrer do jogo, sempre vindo obstáculos e recursos que vão dificultando os puzzles.
 
leandroid151
184 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

First, the company provided a copy to me for review, yes I checked the little box, but just to be sure everyone knows upfront! :D

So now lets take a look at the game, keep in mind there is a backstory to the game and I'll try to reduce spoilers, but you have been warned ;)

→ Game Overview
Portal-esk in concept, where your character volunteered for a research program related to a new paint technology, and over the course of the story, the situation for your character goes from bad to worse. As you advance in the game, the scenarios become progressively more challengeing, requiring you build on your understanding of the gameplay mechanics and to explore new ways of doing the same things, unlocking the door to the next stage.

→Major Features
-Single Player
-Leaderboards (for speed running)
-VR Support (Oculus Rift™ DK2)

→Gameplay
As a 3d interactive puzzle game, it has moments of high excitement followed by periods of calm where you can take your time to figure out how to progress. The use of primary colors throughout the game, and being a core mechanic, feels simple at first, but actually becomes challenging in ensuring you are applying those colors correctly while completing the puzzle. This aspect might frustrate some players looking for a straight forward 'run and gun' experience, but for the puzzle lovers, you might really enjoy this.

→Pros
-Fun gameplay
-Easy to pick up basic mechanics
-Leaderboards for competing with other players
-Challenging Puzzles
-Dev Team is very interested in player experience

→♥♥♥♥
-Some elements could be better explained (looking at you 'paint reflecting' walls)
-Short overall game (speed runners are completing it in ~2 hours)
-Limited replay ability outside of improving speed-run times/score/achievement hunting

→Summary
Overall, while experienced 'portal runners' might find the game on the easy to moderate side early on, some of the later puzzles may make you stop and rethink your strategy a few times, or in some cases even force you to restart the level. This, to me, makes it worth your time if you're into action style puzzle games, like games that try different takes on the 'portal' style of game, or just have that twisted bit within you that enjoys a fun game that tries to constantly kill you!

→Playthrough
My livestream gameplay footage up to the last level (didn't want to spoil the ending ;) )
Vidéo YouTube™: Friday Live Stream - ChromaGun 
Vues : 52
Feel free to drop in and to ask questions about the games on the channel, about other games in general, or if you just want to drop in a be social! ►See a mod you're interested in?

Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

CHROMAGUN

Das Spiel ist ein nettes Puzzlegame aus dem Hause Pixel Maniacs.
Kombinatorisches Denken vorrausgesetzt gibt es in dem Spiel eine Reihe von Rätseln, die es mit Hilfe einer Farbpistole, der sogenannten Chromagun, zu lösen gilt.
Eines jedoch vorweg, wer im Kindergarten oder wenigstens in der Grundschule nicht bei der Farblehre aufgepasst hat, könte in diesem Spiel Probleme bekommen. :)
Für den Preis kann man hier also ruhig mal zuschlagen wenn man auf dieses Genre steht.
Vor allem wenn es gerade im Sale ist.

Hier ein halbstündiges Videoreview zu dem Gameplay, hauptsächlich vom Tutorial:
Vidéo YouTube™: CHROMAGUN ★ Angespielt ★ Gameplay German ★ Kindergartenfarblehre 
Vues : 77
Chromagun Gameplay German Heute wieder ein Angespielt Video zu dem Spiel Chromagun. In dem Spiel geht es darum, sich den Weg durch die verschiedenen Levels mittels einer Farbkanone zu bahnen und mit...

Non recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 avril 2022
I'm tired of these Portal clones that feel like knockoffs instead of something unique. I appreciate the colorblind mode at least, but the inability to remove a color and being forced to reload the whole level just by trying something absolutely kills the enjoyment.
The loading screens between each puzzle are a bit annoying. Puzzles aren't too difficult besides the constant worrying that a single misclick will send you back to the start. The attempted Cave Johnson impression only serves to remind that this is not portal.

1,015 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2019
I got this for free and still feel like i got scammed.
(from a friend)

The puzzles until the 5th chapter are an eyeroller, but even then it's annoying as hell. If you missclick or perhaps end up in the wrong place in any kind of level, you have to restart the level. It's an annoying time waster.
As other reviews mentioned, the game becomes incredibly STRICT with it's timing later on. Specifically ch 6. You have literally to do everything in a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ seconds notice to proceed. If you fail ,well, restart. It's torture.
The graphics, the controls, the narration and the sound design doesn't help the game either.
  • It's hard to hit further walls with the chromagun, since they're too narrow.
  • The mouse sensitivity is quite low even at the maximum option.
  • The jump mechanic is completely useless, you jump 1 milimetre into the air, it should be removed altogether.
  • For some weird reason you can zoom in with the gun... And it's very sloppy.
  • The narrator has a nice voice, however extremely unfunny jokes aswell.
  • The ChromaGun firing sounds are lame and unsatisfying (+the paint removing thing is like skkryyyt skrryyt, eww..).

To be fair, I did like two things about ChromaGun:
  • One of the tests at chapter 4 and most in chapter 7 (if you don't ragequit in the 6th one) are actually competent and truly fun to figure out.
  • Laughed my arse off when at the start of the game, in the lift, i've heard royalty free music. Ma boi Kevin MacLeod. lmao.

    I do not recommend this game. Portal 2 is way better in every aspect.
 
Lovatė

Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Muy interesante,
Al principio lo he visto por completo como un mod de portal, pero segun voy avanzando, puedo ver que tiene su propia personalidad, no deja ver demasiado de un posible lore, es mas, no creo que siquiera lo tenga, pero tampoco lo veo necesario, por ahora voy solo ♥♥♥ 2 capitulos, y la forma en la que van avanzando los puzles me gusta, es muy muy progresivo, nada ♥♥♥ lo que tengas que pensar mas de 3 minutos (A menos que, ♥♥♥ palabras del juego "No hayas ido a preescolar")

El narrador tiene un humor curioso, aun no se si quiere ayudarnos, o vernos sufrir, pero cumple su funcion como forma de "tutorial"

El rendimiento, magnifico, aunque tampoco se podria pedir menos teniendo en cuenta su calidad
♥♥♥ una GTX 960 + FX 8320 Se mantiene estable a 60, no he notado ninguna caida ni nada por el estilo

Quizás lo peor del juego, cosa que lo asemeja aun mas a Portal, son las pantallas de carga, pero al igual que ♥♥♥ este, solo ocurren al cambiar de puzle, marcando el comienzo y el final del mismo de una forma bien definida, así que no lo pondré como algo negativo

Las mecanicas de mezclar colores y de que las piezas se situen en el centro geometrico de lo que pongas de su mismo color, da mucho mucho juego, por ahora, fantastico todo, muy recomendable.
 
Nedeles
414 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2018
You will love this game if you like first person puzzles. I'm surprized why it is not more popular. I'm halfway through and already want a sequel. Strongly recommended it for Portal funs.

Edit: I wrote the paragraph above before playing the second half of the game. Now, I have a different opinion. In the second part you are essentially racing aganist time and you have to be fast. This completely ruins the puzzle side of the game.

Do I still recommend it? Yes, if you buy it during a sale for the sake of the first half.

A puzzle game needs to give the player all the time he needs to think.
 
The Holy Kataruna
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2019
Produit reçu gratuitement

Follow "First Person Exploration and Puzzle Games" for more games like this!
A stylish puzzle game with mediocre puzzles.

The game involves painting walls to move colored balls. The balls kill you if they touch you, and they follow you if there are no painted walls near, which allows you to cheese (or sometimes entirely skip) some puzzles. The atmosphere is very clearly inspired by Portal, which isn't a bad thing. I didn't think any of the puzzles were particularly tricky, though I stopped playing about halfway through.

Overall, I'd say it deserves a neutral, but since that's not an option, I'll give a thumbs up for the fun atmosphere.

dontCry
225 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Titulů, které staví na podobných principech jako Portal najdeme hromadu. Ne všechny ovšem oplývají originálním nápadem. ChromaGun mezi takové naštěstí nepatří. Barvy, okolo kterých se vše točí jsou podle mého názoru nadmíru originální.

Hra, alespoň v počátečních puzzlech, používá naprosto jednoduchý koncept. Máte zbraň, která dokáže střílet barevné kuličky a obarvovat jednotlivé segmenty stěn místnosti. Pak roboty, kteří jsou podle svých barev přitahováni ke stěnám stejné barvy a nakonec tlačítka na zemi, které potřebujete pomocí robotů udržet stisknuté. Zní to jednoduše? Tak to zkuste!
Ale nejdříve si připočtěte to, že ze základních třech barev můžete vytvořit kombinacemi další odstíny a každé pole stěny, nebo robot lze obarvit pouze dvakrát. Jednou základní barvou, třeba červenou, podruhé přidáním další barvy, například modré pro vznik fialové. Po třetím pokusu o přebarvení pole "zrezne" a vy už neuděláte nic. Pak následuje restart levelu.

Prvních pár minut hry se vám opravdu může zdát, že je až příliš jednoduchá, ale to byl Portal taky. Začne ukrutně přituhovat a už po cca deseti minutách vás hra začne nutit pořádně si postup promýšlet.

Zatím jsem nedosáhl vyšších levelů, takže opravdové hardcore levely posoudím až dodatečně, ale musím říct, že na procvičování logického uvažování je hra skvělá.
Navíc plně podporuje VR, konkrétně Oculus Rift, ale myslím, že ji rozjedete i na HTC Vive. S VR systémem bude zážitek určitě ještě mnohem lepší.

Grafika je jednoduchá, ale pro hru tohoto typu naprosto nepodstatná věc. Ovšem design není nikterak krásný, jako třeba v Portalu 2. Prostě je to tuctové, ale vás to stejně zajímat nebude.
Ve hrách tohoto typu je o poznání důležitější hudba a ta je podle mého názoru minimálně dobrá a dá se v klidu poslouchat.
Zvuky také nejsou špatné, jen mě trochu rušil hlas vypravěče, i když barvou hlasu zní skvěle, nějak mi do hry nesedí. Prostě zase vzpomínám na Portal, kde je to dokonalé.

Hra navíc obsahuje i Speedrun režim, kdy se můžete pokusit pokořit protihráče z celého světa. Ve speciálním režimu hra obsahuje počítadlo času, za který se vám podaří hru zdolat. Počítadlo je nastaveno přesně pro potřeby speedrunu a tak se zastavuje při loadingu a počítá opravdu jen při hře. To zajistí, aby byly výsledky na všech počítačích přesné.

Hra podle mě bezproblému poběží i na starších strojích a myslím, že i s VR si poradí průměrné VR Ready sestavy.

Moje hodnocení: 85/100

+skvělý nápad
+přituhující obzížnost puzzlů
+jednoduchá hratelnost, každý zvládne během minuty a to včetně nehráčů
+dobrá hudba
+podpora VR (NETESTOVÁNO)
+speedrun režim

-nehezká grafika
-vadí mi vypravěč, i když se snaží vtipkovat po vzoru Portalu
-obrazovky s nápovědami před jednotlivými levely mají tak nízké rozlišení, že prakticky není možné přečíst jejich nápovědu

Komentovaná ukázka ze hry:
Vidéo YouTube™: [CZ] ChromaGun - Barvičky na posilování hlavičky 
Vues : 323
Nejnovější video: "Velryby ničí svět - Unboxing Kickstarter Collector edice nové české karetky" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XmmiPCAUT_8 --~-- ▼Klikněte na Zobrazit více▼ Kupte si hru:...

MillerOFF_YouTube
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juin 2018
If you've read reviews of people saying "It's just like portal! You will love it if you loved portal!" let me chime in and say "maybe a little bit but nah" Please read on because I do recommend this game once you can get over that it isn't portal.

Both portals imo were worth their full price tags. This one eh not really imo but you be the judge. I got it for half off. It's worth that for sure. Once you come to terms with this not being portal you can enjoy it for what it is. A chill puzzler.

You move these balls or "worker drones" around (some have spikes and chase you) by matching its color to the color of the vertical tiles on the wall. You make/change the color with your gun. Some tiles can't be painted or color changed and same with some of the drones. You make the drones move onto buttons to open doors and solve puzzles. Sometimes you'll need to move a drone onto a dangerous title to destroy it so another drone or you can pass. That's about it. I will admit I haven't completed the game but I am most of the way through it and haven't encounterd much of a difference in the mechanics.

The levels are very easy/tutorial like up until Chapter 2 Level 4. That's kinda the first level where you start having to think. It sneaks up on you with no warning of this spike in difficulty. Some puzzles you will figure out right away and others will have you scratching your head a bit. But just like with any decent puzzler, when you figure it out you feel good hehe.

Overal I'm enjoying it and don't regret the purchase. Again I got for 50% off so take that into consideration.

Only annoying nit-picky thing I'll talk about is the narrator got a tad annoying at some parts. Mainly because there were 1 or 2 levels where I was stuck having to restart and I kept having to hear him say the same monologue several times.

Hope this helps!
 
SparkyNinja

KellyJaneGames.TTV
432 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Got that itch for Portal, but can't be bothered to replay Portal(2) for the umpteenth time? Good, time to stop thinking with Portals and remember how subtractive color addition works!

Chromagun is a first Person Puzzler, and took a lot of inspiration from Portal. The playtime was roughly around 4 hours for me as someone who has played both Portal and Portal 2. There is a "Speedrun" mode implemented as well, so if you're into that.. There's more play time to be had, to really get those best times down.

Graphics and sound are not bad by any means, but they won't be Portal level, of course. They work for the game though since the focus is on the puzzles in the whole game. Speaking about the puzzles, I felt like there were some slight problems in terms of Flow from time to time. I've gotten through some of the apparently more difficult levels with ease, only to be hit i nthe face with a level that is way easier than I anticipated in which I will try to overengineer the solution as much as possible. Then again, that could be a personal quirk as well.

So, this game is about colours, you say, but what about the folks who can't see all the rainbow-y greatness that is this game? Fret not, for this game actually has a pretty snazzy Colourblind mode, overlaying all coloured surfaces with marks that also combine properly when mixing colours.

The ending was somewhat antclimactic in retrospect and is the biggest negative point I have. I mean, the story isn't anything to write hme about either, but serves its purpose - But that ending just felt like a slap in the face compared to Portal. I don't want to spoil too much, but a timed level doesn't make for the best finale, in my opinion.

Would I recommend the game and why/why not?
I'd recommend the game. If you like Portal and want a game for a rainy day/slow night - This is right up your alley. Into speedrunning and want to try something different? Give Chromagun a shot.

Are you looking for a 100hr+ game for $5 max? Go away, deinstall steam and take a looooong walk.
 
Domin0e
560 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2019
This game is thematically a portal ripoff. No clearer way to put it. The white walls, the snarky narrator, even the gun looks extremely similar. That said, it does a pretty good job of emulating the feel of the first couple hours of portal 1 except with Cave Johnson instead of GlaDos. The problem is you never reach the point where you escape, and go behind the scenes like in that game, there's just endless empty white walls. Even when the facility "burns down" its the same crap just now its dark and you need a flashlight.
The story, narrative, setting, is all stolen from portal, which frankly did it better. But to be fair they warn you about all this in the trailer, so I'm not knocking it for this. The narrator in this is pretty entertaining and it definitely adds to the game.

The puzzles are NOT like portal, they are actually original which I give fair credit to. There's about 5 mechanics: nice droids, mean droids, proton walls, paint resetters, and of course 3 primary and 3 secondary colors. This should make for a lot of nuanced puzzles with interesting solutions but frankly ones like that are few and far between here. The creativity doesn't ramp up until the last few levels and even then they aren't really difficult as they are the same puzzles are before just obfuscated enough to where they seem like different puzzles. That's really the theme with this game. They have 5 mechanics that could be used really interestingly but instead they've opted to use simple variations of the instead of making challenging puzzles. It's well over halfway through the game before one of the more interesting mechanics is shown, and it's just used as a delay switch. There is so much empty space in this game its insane, just large blank rooms.

My biggest complaint with this game is that the puzzles are filled with red herrings and thus make it really confusing as to what you're supposed to do. Some of the things in the puzzles literally do nothing, or if they do something, my only guess is that the developer used them as a janky way of making the puzzle work. It ends up that a lot of the time the accomplishment of beating a level was undercut by the feeling that I left about half of it unfinished.

This isn't a bad game, but its not a challenging or thought provoking one, and while entertaining and better made than most, it's still lacking a lot of polish that other games have. There's really no reason to get this unless you have already beat both portal games and just can't get enough of that kind of game.
 
Goblin

Минусы
- Если играть в один присест, то быстро надоедает

0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2018
Produit reçu gratuitement

I usually don't write reviews for games until I've finished them. In this special case, I've finished around 10 levels, and I've got a lot to say.

This game is a representation of potential for a seriously killer and imaginative dev. This game has a the feel of someone's first outing into game development, with excellently long strides in aspects such as teaching game mechanics and progression, and some of the short falls in story and general clunk: things that are often taken for granted when playing games made by super-large team, triple A devs.

Pros:
- Seriously excellent and creative mechanics
- Fun puzzles with good progression
- A clear showcase for potential, a knack for design; puzzle games aren't easy to build

♥♥♥♥/Places to improve:
This section is less, somewhere to tell you what's bad about chromagun, and more constructive feedback aimed at the devs (who I met recently at PAX East).

- Messing up, which is very easy to accidentally do (i.e. creating black, general misfires) can be very unforgiving. There are some opportunities to redeem yourself, but extensive setbacks don't facilitate learning as well as minor ones.
- Opportunities to explore mechanics, such as the rooms located at the ends of levels with some free-style painting, should be presented more often at the beginning of level, to prepair the player for the guided learning.

Overall, I see no reason not to play this game; unless you are:
- Unimaginative
- Poor at Puzzles
- Addicted to spending 60 dollars
- Someone who makes impossible expectations
- Are one of those people who think servers at restaraunt are your personal servants (in which case you don't deserve to have fun)

I like this and I think you will too.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mai 2017
This is a super fun first-person puzzle game in the vein of Portal, wherein you are a test subject for a pretty shady corporation with a sarcastic narrator. But besides the fact that they're both puzzle games, that's mostly where the similarities end.

Mechanics:
You are equipped with a ChromaGun, which can shoot three colors: yellow, green, and blue. The colors can also be combined with each other to make magenta, green and orange. You use these colors to attract similarl colored hovering, sometimes murderous spheres to activate switches. Puzzles get more intricate with ones that require a lot of planning (since you can only add color, not subtract it, so level restarts are your only way to erase wrong colors), ones that need split second timing (there are a couple countdown events that require shaving off seconds to beat it before dying), ones that require you to reuse finite resources, ones where you have to complete a puzzle while being charged down by murderous "HelperBots", etc.

Pros:
+There's a great deal of puzzle variety, as stated above, with timed challenges, take-your time color puzzles, don't waste your finite resources puzzles, open doors in the correct sequence or get stuck puzzles, etc.
+Good difficulty curve. Starts easy and gets progressively more difficult. Never seemed impossible, but there are definitely some thinkers.
+Great mechanic.
+Funny narration

Neutral:
~Length: I ran about 6 hours, including getting stuck and retrying a puzzle that I didn't realize I had actually solved, some idling, etc. I thought it felt like a pretty good length, but I could have definitely done with some more puzzles because it was actually really well done! Some people may feel it's too short but I personally don't feel cheated.

♥♥♥♥:
-As stated above, narration was funny, but if you died a lot you'd get the same 3 or so dialogue snippits upon respawn, no matter how many times you died. It would have been nice if it recognized that you had already died several times in the same manner, so you don't need to be reminded not to touch the murderbots for the 6th time. (Like, I KNOW already.)
-There was one mechanic in the late-game that wasn't really introduced well. It didn't help that the effects of what you were doing weren't visible except from one weird angle, so I didn't know the piece I needed had been put into place until about a half hour later. There's only 1 other puzzle with this mechanic, and it is actually more obvious what is going on in the SECOND puzzle, which isn't a big help, honestly.

Overall: If you like good puzzlers with a fun mechanic, buy this game! 9/10. I'd definitely replay this game once I've forgotten most of the solutions.
 
TheDContinuum
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

I finally finished the entire game, and did a full walkthrough/let's play of this game on my channel.
Plus, I've earned all the achievements.

Anyways, I wish to thank all of the people who made this game, and with that, come with my honest opinion, so people can find this helpful, and as well, tell the people at Pixel Maniacs what I think.

Despite I got this for free from the company, I don't believe that should effect my opinion.
The price should be lowered, since I can't see it being worth 13 Euros, when you can complete the entire game within a short period of time, around the 10 Euros would be more fitting.

I truly enjoyed the concept, the idea of a puzzle game, which involves colors, was something that I haven't tried before, and that was truly something different, than what I normally play.
However, the game did seem quite short, and it has it's few moments that can be tricky. The only hard times, are when you're forced to make a wild guess. I believe that the game could've easily be longer, and a lot more challenging.

I must say, that I enjoyed the narrator and his evil voice, giving you some kind of hints now and then, but you barely heard from him later on in the game.

What I pretty much asked for, is more gameplay, and a greater challenge as you progress.
With all this said, the game is not bad at all, it's worth playing, but it should be for a smaller price then, since it is as short, as it is.

Big applause to Pixel Maniacs for this nice game. =)

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
55.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2016
Okay, my first review, but here we go:

Choma Gun is a 1st-Person Puzzle Shooter, whith Colors-Pellets instead of Lead-Bullets, dark Humor instead of dark Colors and Death instead of... forget it ^^'
There are 26 Levels/Sections, divided in 8 Chapters, which have different tasks realized with a few, but cleverly used game-play mechanics, such as

"lazy" bots (will only move when they are colored like a wall in their close vicinity),
"stalking" bots (which want to help you, but can be a real pain in the ass),
walls (usually white, but sometimes pre-colored)
"Fences" (which prevent you from coloring bots or walls)
and several more.

The graphics are, while not as realistic as some other games, as good as needed that there are no misunderstandings in the puzzles, so you can see the difference between a "stalking" bot and a normal, lazy one.
Since I have a really weak machine (384 Cuda-Cores, DDR3-Ram) I had several times lags when there was a bit more happening on the screen, but it wasn't impossible to solve the puzzle in those levels.

There are not many soundtracks, but they work well in the game, since you'll think hard most of the time, so the soundtrack does not disturb your thoughts. There is one person whom you'll hear often enough, he explains some mechanics, but most of the time he'll annoy you with some information that you are not good enough. It'll ceasy soon enough, but until then you'll be annoyed

While my first playthrough was roughly 2 Hours, it is possible to finish the game in less that 40 Minutes, when you have memorized it at least once. The puzzles were sometimes challenging, sometimes eazy and sometimes you had to know that the solution was easier than anticipated

There are achievements, some tend to annoy a little bit (after every chapter is one achievement), others are well designed, so you have to search, think and act a little bit different to unlock 'em all.

I personally recommend everyone this game, that likes to think or wants to experience a puzzle-game that is easy to understand, but not so easy to master.

Non recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2020
I got this game on sale for about $3.00 and honestly considered returning it.

Initially its not a bad concept, but the levels are incredibly repetitive with almost no new concepts thrown in throughout the whole game.

It is INCREDIBLY easy to soft-lock yourself in a level, requiring you to go to the menu and restart a level repeatedly.

What little dialogue that exists is almost entirely comprised of half-baked portal references that got on my nerves VERY quickly.

I spent 3.5 hours completing this game and getting every achievement (solely because I wanted the extra achievements for my profile) and can confidently say I will NEVER be installing or playing this game again.

Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 décembre 2022
Было бы странно отрицать очевидное и не сравнивать ChromaGun с серией Portal. Камон, это же очередные эксперименты с пушкой в лаборатории! Вот только нет в этой игре таких очаровательных персонажей, как GLaDOS. Так что авторы могли бы и без сюжета обойтись, стало бы даже лучше.

С другой стороны, было бы странно в очередной раз сравнивать что-то с Portal. Камон, это физическая головоломка от первого лица, таких множество. В конце концов, если посмотреть на это, как на стиль portallike, то всё становится на свои места.

Но главное, что суммарно ChromaGun мне понравился. Задачки несложные, но я здесь не только ради сложности, а в том числе ради радости после преодоления уровней, которые можно щёлкать, как семечки. Основным минусом является то, что в случае ошибки уровень приходится проходить заново. Но это по-своему тоже увлекательно и держит в тонусе.

В общем, не ждите многого, и тогда вы получите удовольствие. А потом почитайте про все существующие цветовые модели, коих насчитывается около 2 десятков, удивитесь, почему в игре используется модель RYB, и окунитесь в мир колориметрии в целом!

Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 avril 2016
Copy of the game provided by the developers

I have been playing ChromaGun for a couple of hours and I can tell this game is going to be loved by all those who like a puzzle game. There is a good amount of humor and the narrator voice is pure honey, you're going to enjoy listening to it even when it says how dumb you are for failing the puzzle for the 22nd time in a row.
Speaking of puzzles, they get challenging pretty quickly and some will test your planning skills as well as your reflexes.

The game is about mixing the primary colors in order to get some droids to point A to point B, sometimes painting walls, others painting the drones themselves. Other times you'll have to make the drones suicide on electrified floor in order to be able to progress with the puzzle. As the game says: if you went to primary school you won't have any troubles understanding the game mechanics.
Graphically and musically speaking, the game is average, nothing to write home about, but both get their job done. The music is very relaxing and helps the thinking a lot and the graphics could be better, sure, but could also be much worse.

Overall I agree with most of the reviews: this game is a solid puzzle game that you'll enjoy a lot, with a "portal" feeling to it but also it's own soul.

Évaluation publiée le 16 octobre 2023
Sympathique puzzle-game indé à la première personne héritié de Portal.
La seule et unique mécanique étant de pouvoir coloré les cases des murs ou des boules droïdes attiré par elles de 7 couleurs différentes pour résoudre des puzzles & ouvrir la porte du niveau suivant.
Il faudra faire attention de même vu que certains droïdes peuvent nous tuer dans leur ronde.
Un peu dommage qu'on ne puise pas revenir à du blanc car une fois la couleur apposé on ne pourra plus que la mixer ce qui nous imposera de recommencé le niveau entier en cas d'erreur & complexifier certains puzzles.
Il se fait bien même si ça se complique assez rapidement surtout à partir du chapitre 5 où les couleurs seront temporaires & certains timings très courts.

DiKaPa_Twitch
1,410 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2020
ChromaGun is an incredibly short game (around five hours max), but it's well worth trying if you're into complicated puzzle games such as that of the Portal series or Enigma Prison. While I do recommend it, I think it's well in need of some changes, so this review is more aimed toward the developers rather than prospective players. The game is very complex, and if you're interested, I'd suggest giving it a spin, as the price ($12) is a steal. Anyways, without further adieu, here are some little critiques I had throughout my playthrough.

1) The Levels Are EXTREMELY Specific
One of my main gripes with this game is how specific the levels tend to be. For example, if you need to bring a workerdroid from one spot to another and that workerdroid dies, what happens? In most games, another one would spawn in the original location, or maybe a "Game Over" would appear. In ChromaGun, nothing happens. You just sit there and are expected to restart the level from the pause menu (which, by the way, is super annoying). Not to mention that one slip-up can cause you to restart the ENTIRE level from scratch.
Not that this is always a bad thing, however. The game can be very difficult when it wants to, so the limited solving paths makes sense. However, be prepared to restart the level A LOT. Just part of the process.

2) The Wacky World of ChromaTech
ChromaGun tends to be quite clever with its use of colors and mechanics, and is especially exemplified with the inclusion of devices that automatically paint the wall after a short time. This opens up the puzzles into another dimension, and it's a well appreciated addition. But they're also a little annoying, but I think that's just me.
One thing I REALLY wish this game did was expand on the workerdroids. It's mentioned throughout the game that the workerdroids are constantly in pain and slaves to the testing center, which led me to believe that they would stage some sort of revolution near the end of the story. Sadly, this never happened, but I'm hopeful for a sequel where they explore this.

3) Sound Design
The sound design of ChromaGun will make you lose your mind. Throughout the game (which, by the way, I did finish in 4.5hrs around a year ago), the same soundtrack plays practically all the time, aside from a few exceptions. I actually had to turn off the music to concentrate cause it was so maddening. However, the music was bad- the music was great, rather. It fits the environment and does build an atmosphere to the game. However, it became annoying, much like most of the stuff I've been mentioning.

Overall, ChromaGun is not for the faint of heart. It's built for puzzle-enthusiasts, and when you find the end, you get a welcome surprise. I realize that I've mainly been listing negatives, but this review is more of a critique on what to improve rather than one for players. Deep down, I want this game to be better. On all other fronts, it's a great game.
~Shep
 
Shepster

Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2021
6.5/10

白金了来评测下。
我发现很多人在评论里提及了传送门，可能是因为类似一个个实验室的背景和起源fps引擎。但是本作的游戏内容和传送门有本质不同。难度更低，流程更短都是小事。更重要的在于，本作是一个“平面”游戏，而你的人物也不能跳跃，这使得3d引擎其实完全没有实际意义。如果直接做成一个平面俯视视角，游戏体验甚至会更好。3d解谜的优点之一，就在于可以充分利用空间的丰富性，利用上和下的关系创作谜题。传送门系列，塔罗斯的法则，见证者等作无不深谙此道。如果本质上只是一个平面游戏，为什么要用更让玩家dizzy的3d第一人称视角呢？我认为没有充分利用“空间”是本作难以回避的缺点。
尽管如此，本作作为一个谜题合理，简单休闲的解密游戏，还是值得拿到一个及格分。而颜色叠加的推理也算有点意思。
另外，这游戏是我目前唯一一个白金了卡还没掉全的游戏，发了评测我可能还得挂几分钟卡……掉卡速度太慢也算半个缺点吧。
 
花园百合铃
415 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
8.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2019
I recently bought this game during the recent Steam sale because it looked interesting. I must admit I like the concept of painting walls and droids to progress through the different puzzles. However, one strike against this game for me was that it was too similar to Portal: test chambers, a gun, sterile environment, a snarky announcer making darkly humorous quips, and nearly being killed at several points. The puzzles started off decent, but got more tedious in the later chapters, and dodging and running from WorkerDroids got tiring. It also felt that the last few chapters dragged on a bit too long.

Also, you could make a drinking game out of this: take a drink every time the narrator utters the word "sensational".

So overall, I thought this game was mediocre at best, and I would only recommend buying it if it's on sale.
 
asears16
59 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Когда-то стримил эту игру, заходи ко мне разработчик и такой, "а ты давай пройди, я тебе секрет покажу"
И да, разработчик заходит на стрим своей игры,это не может не радовать.Спасибо за приятные эмоции.
По поводу самой игры, это, как игра Portal только с головоломками в другом стиле.Игра стоит своих денег, единственное что огорчает - это отсутствие русского языка.Надеюсь разработчики исправят эту проблему.

Non recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2022
Не покупайте. Это не портал, даже не близко. Игра очень примитивная. Уровни по сложности вперемешку, а не по нарастающей. Музыка однообразная и бесит через час. Уровни вроде простые, но если ошибетесь с цветом то рестарт - нельзя удалить цвет, хотя в самой игре есть штука которая через время удаляет краску с поверхности. Даже по скидке не рекомендую. Купил на свою голову и теперь уже прийдется пройти до конца.
 
iShi
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
55.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2018
There's some well-designed puzzles and the core colour mechanic works just fine, but I got incredibly tired of several things while playing this game. First and foremost, just how shameless a Portal ripoff it is. (Consider that there's an achievement for finding a hidden cake called "Not A Lie") Frankly, it's a little bit galling that this game has been as commercially successful as it has been, but I'm sure Valve have too many billion dollars to care. Second, the gags just don't land. They draw a smirk at best and are repeated over and over and over and over again (no, I didn't step on the deadly electrified maintenance tiles because I forgot they'd kill me, thank you very much). Third, the voiceover guy really can't act. His voice is pleasing enough, but he's not a very good actor.

5.5/10. The only reason I have as many hours as I do is because this game launched with a speedrunning contest and I tried my hand at that.
 
emeraldaly
2,411 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2019
Suppose to be a puzzle game.
It is in the first half stages, but turned to speedrun and guessing game in the rest of the game.

And somehow using a 144hz monitor is laggy and dizzy, using 60 hz is more smoother.
I can't achieve 144 and above. Seems like vsync is always on.
Don know it is due to vsync unconsistence of frame time or the game cannot run normally above 60 fps or what

Few stages designed very badly, such as 8-1 and 8-3, especially 8-3. kinda nonsense

No quick save and quick load, so you need to restart when you messed up

Some times you need to shoot and run faster like a speedrun action instead of thinking (kinda weird in puzzle game)

Quite short game play

 
alex1234950
198 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2020
There's a lot of potential here, and initially I was enjoying the game quite a bit. But I play puzzle games because I enjoy solving puzzles, not because I enjoy attempting to emulate split-second reaction times, and after a while there are a couple places where the latter is required after not being initially indicated. This is coupled with puzzles where there is frequently only one way to solve it. The combination of those two traits means that on some levels, such as Chapter 5 Floor 3, the only way to get through is to learn what you need to do, get stuck, and restart so you can do it again quickly enough. When your solution requires multiple failures, you've designed a bad puzzle.
 
Osage Morgan

Tonynecko
116 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Buen juego de puzzles de los alemanes Pixel Maniacs

Juego de puzzles ♥♥♥ una estética muy similar a Portal pero ♥♥♥ mecánicas diferentes, basadas en la gama cromática y la mezcla de colores, muy recomendable para los que les guste este tipo de juegos. Tiene una especie de narrador que nos va contando un poco la "historia" del juego y que hacemos ahí probando la "pistola" de colores. Los puzzles empiezan siendo muy sencillos para que vayamos acostumbrándonos a las mecánicas jugables y van subiendo la dificultad de manera progresiva, algunos son realmente complicados.

Dura aproximadamente unas 5 horas, quizá un poco escaso para los 13 euros que vale, pero se puede conseguir en las rebajas de steam por unos 5 euros.

En cuanto a gráficos cumple de sobra, no destaca especialmente pero en lo que he podido probar no he encontrado ni bugs, ni falllos de ningún tipo. El sonido también cumple ♥♥♥ unas buenas melodías que amenizan las partidas sin molestar ni resultar repetitivas en ningún momento. Entre pantalla y pantalla tiene tiempos de carga, pero son minimos, no molestan en absoluto.

Por último comentar que para los más enganchados a los puzzles cuenta ♥♥♥ un modo SpeedRun para que os piquéis intentado hacer los puzzles en el menor tiempo posible xD.

Chromagun Review | Gameplay Español | Primeras Impresiones 
Une vidéo de
Par : Veron1505
Chromagun Review | Gameplay Español | Primeras Impresiones Os traigo unas primeras impresiones de Chromagun, juego de Pixel Maniacs que me lo ha cedido para que pueda dar mi opinión sobre el mismo.

191 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

Pro:
+ Rätsel sind gut designed
+ viele verschiedene Möglichkeiten beim Rätseldesign
+ solide Grafik
+ Easter-Eggs
+ mächtiger Level-Editor + Workshop-Anbindung (!)
+ kleiner Preis
+ grundsätzlich gelungenes Balancing
+ Spielzeit geht mit etwa 5h in Ordnung
+ alle Achievements einfach erreichbar
+ keine Bugs/Abstürze/etc.

Contra:
- Story dem großen Vorbild Portal unterlegen
- leichte Schwankungen im Schwierigkeitsgrad
- Finale etwas "seicht"
- Manchmal muss man das Level ganz neu laden, wenn man eine falsche Farbe geschossen hat (-> "Sackgassen" möglich)

Fazit: Fans von Portal sollten einen Blick riskieren

85 / 100
 
mc-squared
1,725 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 février 2016
This is a fun game if you like games like Portal. I know this game is the first one the studio made and they did a good job in my opinion.

Some things I didn't like as much is that there are no checkpoints in the levels itself like there are in Portal. If you fail at the last part of a room, you have to completely redo it and is especially annoying at those life threatening levels. Also, the game is a little short and I hope they'll add (free/cheap) expansions to this game and maybe a map editor for the Steam Workshop.

All in all it's a good game but with only 3.4 hours on the timer and like a 30 minute sitting idle in a room makes this a short but fun game.
 
Krowi
434 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Bon tout d'abord merci aux développeurs de m'avoir envoyé le jeu sur mon Stream.

Alors j'ai pu tester le jeu une treintaine de minutes, et il en ressort beaucoup de positif. Pour les fans de Portal, foncez.
Le seul petit défaut de ce jeu c'est les détails. Le fais de rester bloquer dans un mur à cause d'un mob par exemple et du coup devoir recommencer le niveau, même chose pour les portes, certains mobs peuvent, si on les gèrent mal, nous bloquer des accès nécessaires pour continuer à avancer dans le jeu (Je ne parle pas des mobs incolorent qui bloquent volontairement les entrées, mais de ceux qui te bloquent après les avoirs attaqués).

Bref, je vais mettre une évaluation positive, même si j'arrête le jeu là, parce qu'il est bien mais spécial. Regardez quelques Let's Play pour vous faire un avis avant de l'acheter, je penses que ça en vaut la peine.

Dernier petit point : Attendez des soldes, le jeu est un poil cher pour ce que c'est (6€, c'est amplement suffisant je penses pour un tel jeu)

Merci à l'équipe de développement, qui en plus d'être sympathique, est réactive (J'ai demandé par mail s'il pouvaient me donner quelques clés en plus à faire gagner sur mon live, clés qu'ils m'ont envoyées dans l'heure qui suivait mon mail :) )
 
Areulawl
269 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Mon avis sur Chromagun

Chromagun est un petit jeu indé du studio Pixel Maniacs
A l'heure actuelle, je n'ai pas finis le jeu mais pour le moment il me parait sympathique en terme de gameplay qui rappelle un peu le style de Portal

Le principe est de jouer avec les couleurs qui sont contrôlables grâce au Chromagun que vous possédez et avec des sphères qui seront attirées par les couleurs que vous mettrez sur les murs grâce au Chromagun .
C'est un puzzle vraiment bon enfant malgré quelques absences entre les niveaux, en effet, à chaque fin de niveau il ne se passe rien alors qu'il y a la présence d'une voix qui semble être dans le même univers que Glados ( portal )
Même si à un certain niveau on sent un scénario ( je répète , je n'ai pas finit le jeu donc le côté scénario je ne jugerais pas )

Le jeu m'a été envoyé par Pixel Maniacs, j'ai donc réaliser une vidéo pour les remercier. ( mauvaise qualité due au logiciel d'enregistrement .. )

Vidéo YouTube™:  
Vues : 0


13€ à l'heure actuelle si vous hésitez à cause du prix attendez les soldes, mais il vaut vraiment le coup !

Definitivamente es una joya, Acertijos desafiantes y mecanicas divertidas que ademas requieren pensamiento veloz cuando uno eventualmente se equivoca

la musica no sobresale pero tampoco es mala, los controles son sencillos e intuitivos

282 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

E' un gioco davvero carino e simpatico , ChromaGun è un puzzle-game in prima persona che ti farà accendere la tua mente e allenare la tua intelligenza. Perchè ragazzi questo gioco piano piano si farà sempre più contorto e difficile fino a farti spremere tutta la tua materia grigia!
Ha una grafica veramente fatta bene e accativante. Infatti se mi avessero detto che questo gioco fosse fatto dalla Valve ci avrei creduto a pieno, perchè sembra Portal 3 o una mod creata dalla communità.
Ha un gameplay ingegnoso che ti farà avvolte incazzare per alcuni livelli ma del resto è studiato ad hoc.
Inoltre ha un apparato audio veramente dolce e rilassante.

Pro -
Audio eccelente e rilassante
Gameplay carino e accattivante
Puzzle ben elaborati e avvolte complicati
Atmosfera di Portal

Contro -
Avvolte un po monotono
Non è doppiato in italiano
Sosia di Portal

Voto generale: 7
 
Ruleeez
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Someone send me a copy with the request to review it (without me even asking).

So I've played it all the way through and unlocked all achievements (even the hidden ones) in just above 3 hours.

Funny little puzzle game that is with no doubt inspired by portal and the idea of mixing colors.

Well.... thats about it.
didnt blew my mind but was fun while it lasted.

Because its rather short, I probably wouldnt be willing to pay more than 5 bucks for it.

Worth mentioning:
It has a build in speedrun mode that gives you a timer that stops during loading screens.
Could be fun for dedicated players to speedrun this game

Yaekana
1
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Wer schon Spaß an der Portalreihe hatte, wird mit diesem Titel sicher nichts falsch machen. Stimmungsvoller Puzzle-Spaß mit der Vielfalt der Farben und kniffligen Aufgaben.

Das Spiel ist Einsteigerfreundlich und führt den Spieler gut an die Aufgaben und Mechaniken ran und steigert den Schwierigkeitsgrad zunehmend, um auch erfahrene Rätselmeister zum Nachdenken zu bewegen. Die Spielmechaniken sind einfach zu lernen und gut umzusetzen. Meiner Meinung nach fehlen nur an mancher Stelle Speicherpunkte, um nicht gesamte Rätsel neu lösen zu müssen.

Wer sich also mit angriffslustigen Workerdroids rumschlagen will und dabei seinen Denkmuskel trainieren mag ist hier gut aufgehoben.
 
Ustra_Ahazu

Recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 juillet 2016
Un juego bastante entretenido, me recuerda mucho a Portal, salvo que ♥♥♥ ese toque "indie".

Muy entretenido para los amantes de los retos y los puzzles, la verdad que al principio parece facilón, pero a medida que avanza y vas teniendo que combinar los 3 colores basicos para sacar los demas colores de la gama cromatica, y así poder solucionar los puzzles va escalando la dificultad de una forma asombrosa.

Os dejo unas primeras impresiones sobre el juego:

Évaluation publiée le 28 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Please read: i got this for free from the community manager because of my youtube channel, and they asked for a little bit of vids about the game, so i agreed but me opinion is completly mine :D
Pros -
-cool actor
-nice art style
-creative floors
-creative idea for the game
-8 chapters (didn't finish yet but thats quite a lot for a 13 bucks game :D)
-Some floors are pretty darn challanging!
♥♥♥♥ -
-Limited colors, would like more :P
-A great feature is a community creator tool, will really extend the lifetime and fanbase of the game
-Sometimes wierd firing animations but im sure this can be fixed
-More gadgets other then the gun, and more ball types :)
-Would like a time reverse tool, because if i get to the end of a level and accidently screw the level up, i wouldn't want to start the level all over again, so a time reverse tool would be cool :D

Thats it, the game is good fun, and i good time burner for us puzzle games lovers
good price for good content!
Would enjoy community levels really, i'd play it alot :D

Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2019
Habe schon tageweise Portal, Portal2, Talos Principle etc. gespielt und genossen - dieses Spiel musste ich leider wegen Übelkeit nach 30 Minuten beenden und habe es wieder deinstalliert (KEIN VR, sondern normal am PC!). Schade eigentlich, ich wäre gerne in einen höheren Schwierigkeitsgrad vorgestoßen.
Also: wer sich nicht ganz sicher ist, sollte vor dem Kauf erst die Demo testen, ob der Magen das Spiel ebenfalls mag.
Ansonsten wäre es bei dem Preis wohl ganz okay gewesen, wenngleich es in vielerlei Hinsicht nicht an Portal (1/2) heranreicht.

10/10 love the game, its fun and sometimes hard as ****

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Взрываем мозг изнутри!

Игры-головоломки может и не идут на первых местах в игровых чартах, но всегда занимают отдельное место среди всех остальных игр. По пальцам можно пересчитать интересные и познавательные проекты. И с годами почти ничего не меняется. Приятно, что в 2016 году в ряды увлекательных, в меру сложных и необычных игр прибавилась ещё одна - ""Chroma Gun"".
Хотя весь сценарий укладывается в пару фраз, да и присутствует скорее для антуража, в самой игре полностью забываешь о чём-либо, но целиком погружаешься в процесс решения различных головоломок. Первые 10 минут вообще не испытываешь какой-то сложности и на минуту посещает мысль о скором прохождении всей игры, но уже через пару уровней неожиданно сталкиваешься с ситуацией из которой не можешь выйти. Вроде бы лёгкая задача превращается в затруднение, а ещё через минут 10 она тебя начинает уже и раздражать. Однако именно такими моментами, которые ставят игрока в тупик должна и может похвалиться наша сегодняшняя героиня.
Спустя несколько следующих уровней, погрузившись в происходящее и освоившись с принципами и логикой игры ты уже начинаешь постепенно, но безвозвратно менять своё мнение с прохладного до восторженного. Именно так произошло и со мной. В начале я проявил интерес к игре, затем она меня несколько озадачила и начала даже напрягать своей неочевидностью, но после успешного завершения нескольких уровней и появления чувства преподнятости интеллекта над машиной ))) моё мнения окончательно перешло в категорию восхищения.
Эта игра взрывает твой мозг изнутри и ты этому радуешься! Красочная головоломка от PixelManiacs[pixel-maniacs.com] обязательно понравится всем любителям сложностей. И эта игра предоставит вам массу возможностей убедиться в собственном бессилии в решении очередной задачи... или покажет Твой исключительный интеллект)))

Искренне рекомендую всем! А если хотите увидеть игровой процесс и услышать мои комментарии и мнение об игре, тогда смотрите Стрим-прохождение "Chroma Gun"

Vidéo YouTube™:  
Vues : 0


И большая благодарность, Крису из Pixel Maniacs за возможность познакомиться с этой игрой-головоломкой.

Many thanks to Chris from Pixel Maniacs for this game! I was very surprised given support and the opportunity to get to know your game "ChromaGun".

С уважением, Дмитрий Харитонов / Dinlog / 27 июля 2016 г.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
8.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2021
Ни в коем случае не рекомендую покупать эту игру за деньги. Да и бесплатно не нужно играть.
Я наивно поверила трейлеру, который пообещал игру в духе "Portal" и "Portal 2". Оценки критиков, множество положительных отзывов и рецензии тоже внушали доверие и я купила эту игру... OMG...
В начале все шло хорошо, было даже интересно, но, как говорится, "начали за здравие, закончили за упокой".
Невероятно тупые повороты в сюжете, которого вообще кот наплакал.
Тупые чекпоинты, которые в случае принятии неправильного решения, заставляют проходить весь блок заново.
Сложность задач идет не по нарастающей, а как *** пошлет.
Бесячий мужик, который пытается быть дофига остроумным.
Саундтреков не завезли. Нельзя просто так взять и написать еще одну тему.
Гг вообще баран на веревочке. Моя оценка 0/10
P.S. Ачивка за найденый тортик кроме как ненависть не вызвала ничего.
P.S.S. Тот, кто назвал эту игру "младшим братом GLaDOS, величайший врун, каких еще поискать надо.
 
baranman
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 octobre 2020
Inspired by aperture science and how funny Glados is, Tom Hanks creates his own company and a less interesting science gun to laugh at people as he subjects them to human testing. It's an interesting game. Less physics based more... paint that attracts balls... based... Makes you wonder what the point of this facility even is, but then you remember its probably all to make Tom Hanks happy so you keep going anyways. Beat it in like 3 hours. I'd deeply recommend portal or portal 2, before I'd recommend this, but if you have a tiny itch on the 3D puzzle solving part of your brain, this game was ok. Does not actually feature Tom Hanks...

This is one of those games were you think 'How hard can it be?' then when you start getting into the puzzles and getting owned by spikey balls from hell, you wonder 'I can't be this stupid'.

I had the pleasure of playing this game for free and I would definately recommend this to any puzzle loving gamer out there. With notes of The Stanley Parable and Portal, this is game worth your time.

Dixon Cox
285 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2020
It's like Portal, but worse, but still good! ChromaGun is a simple, medium-ish length puzzle game that gets a lot of use out of its handful of mechanics. The addition of a couple mandatory timed levels and the occasional unavoidable, always-chasing-you hostile swarm of enemies make this slightly less casual but still mostly casual-friendly. The soundtrack is bland but unobtrusive, and the overall visual aesthetic is actually nice, if simple!

The story, such as it is (and there really, really isn't much of one, is actually remarkably well voice-acted! I get the feeling that they set the budget for VO work really low, though, got someone remarkable to do, he took a look at the script, and said "I can voice any 20 of these lines for you given the cash you have for this" and so they just stopped there and cut their losses. Because again, they really do not have much in the way of a story. It has the same comically hostile and sarcastic vibe as the Portal villain, except all up front instead of having a slow build up to insanity. You will also go the majority of each chapter without even hearing from the guy. Honestly, even though the puzzles themselves were good, the hardest one yet is trying to figure out post-game how they thought it was worth it to pass off such a meager script when they could have done so much more.

Regardless, I had fun. I'm glad I bought this game!
 
Recremen

Recommandé
19.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2017
Soweit ist es ein tolles Spiel.Was die Farblehre angeht kenne ich allerdings nur die gängigsten Grundtonmischungen,was schnell zu Fehlmischungen führt und das dann zum Tot.

Nachdem man in Kapitel 4 Ebene 7 schon dem Feuer entkommen ist das gelegt wurde um das Gebäude abzufackeln (illegale Firma) und man es dann geschafft hat durch die Dunkelheit die nun im Gebäude herrscht mit einer Funzel von Taschenlampe durch ein kleines Labyrinth zu kommen,wird es dann auf Kapitel 5 Ebene 3 voll hektisch und der Zeitdruck nimmt gewaltig zu.Auf der nächsten Ebene ist der Zeitruck dann so groß das ich mich frug ob es noch Sinn macht weiter zu spielen.Kurz darauf wurde der Zeitdruck wieder weggenommenund ich konnte aufatmen.Aber nur kurz denn owei zwei Kammern weiter war der Zeitdruck wieder da.

Ich denke ohne das man sich ein gutes Let's Play zu der einen oder anderen Ebene ansehen muß um wenigstens die Chance zu haben das Spiel zu Ende zu bringen.Also Daumen aber mit Einschränkungen.

4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2016
It's a great game. I don't believe I've gotten that far yet, but what I've seen is good. The basic rules on what to do are pretty simple, with each puzzle involving using combinations of colours to guide the droids into opening doors.

The game looks good, with a nice sciencey-type theme. I haven't noticed any glitches or weird texture problems or anything like that yet, which is great. There's also some good voice acting, with the person I assume is in charge of the test facilities guiding you and giving some funny comments.

Wannacry
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 juin 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

I was contracted a few days ago and asked to give ChromaGun a try and showcase it on my channel. Well, i did and found out that this game is very in-depth when it comes to solving puzzles.

In the begining you start off with some easy puzzles to solve to enable you to make it to the exit. After, this the fun begins. On each floor the puzzles start to get increasingly harder and harder which gives you more of a challenge. On each floor you have to look around and see where the droids are located and what color they are.

Then you have to get them to a location that will unlock the Exit door enabling you to leave. Now, when you get to the higher levels you have to watch out for floor tiles that will destroy the worker droids. Which make for an even better challenge to each level.

After, playing Chromagun twice, I give this game very high marks for it Graphics and Mechanics of game play. The scenes between levels are very short and not enough time to read them is the only draw back that i have so far with ChromaGun.

After, seeing some of the reviews given/written i would agree on one of them, "Food for the Brain Cells -- By Games!Magazin"

I have rated this game 9/10 Stars[/b].
 
(HoS)DireWolfe3
154 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Below you can view my first impressions video with the game.

Gifted to me by the devs for purposes of review, i have to say, this game is quite fun. I'm not much for puzzle games but this is very intelligently designed. I like the fact that you can solve the problems with multiple different strategies. The narrator borders on funny, to annoying, but mostly funny and i like how they taunt you on just how elementary it is to mix colors. You would be surprised how much you forgot about Kindergarden until your very life depends on it :D

Definitely recommend this to puzzle game fans, and this made a fan out of me... the kind of gamer who mostly just likes to blow s$%t up and murder faces with a hammer/axe/bow or other medieval weaponry that comes to mind!

Maranatha
221 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juin 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

I recieved this game for free with a request to stream and write a review. The Dev didn't pay my $32,420 sellout fee so recieving it for free didn't effect my review.

Let's start off by stating that I don't like puzzle games. I like to shoot bad guys, slay dragons, and bang sorceresses. I don't find great joy in being made to feel stupid by a game, thats what life is for. Ok, so onto the game.

Chromagun is a puzzle game where you use your "paint gun" to change the color of walls and balls to move the balls where you need to solve the puzzle which opens the door to the next room. Sounds simple unless you make a mistake...I made a lot. And then there are these "angry balls" that like to come ♥♥♥♥ with you...while the narrator talks ♥♥♥♥ to you. Still the game was pretty straight forward as I figured out little tricks to control the balls...I mean worker drones, just remembered WTF they are called, the game would throw tougher and tougher puzzles until I finally got to the point that the game was smarter and I gave up, proud of the progress I did make.

PROS:
Easy to learn
Smooth Controls
Simple Concept
Graphics were better than expected
AHole Narrator
Challenging

♥♥♥♥:
AHole Narrator

Should you buy it? If you like puzzle games give it a shot, it's pretty damn good. Still cheaper than most of your bad decisions and won't give you VD. If you don't like puzzle games obviously skip it.

8/10 would get chased by angry balls again
 
SmokinDank5280

Non recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juin 2019
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

So youre looking at this and thinking...oh another Portal wannabe...and like most other wannabes this game fails in almost every aspect.
Most of my playtime was wasted on restarting a level,not because I didnt know how to solve it but because you have to make mistakes to learn how to beat a level.
There are 8 chapters in the game and 7 of them feel like a tutorial,really exstra easy difficulty.I felt like the game is beginning on the last chapter and then it was over.
Maybe this game would be better if iit had a good story but it fails to deliver that too.
Cannot recommend this,this game insults your intelligence.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation

1,783 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2017
Среднячёк.

  • В головоломках сюжет не обязателен. Поэтому его отсутствие не опечаливает.
  • Динамика есть, хоть и наигранная.
  • Механика в головоломках нова, что однозначно плюс.
  • Звуковое сопровождение приятное, но треков мало.
  • Графика без лишних деталей, сплошные лабораторные стены, но приятные глазу (а-ля Portal 1).
  • Игра не сложная, что больше всего меня расстроило.
  • Механика себя исчерпывает к концу игры, так что с продолжительностью разработчики угадали (3-4 часа).
  • Любители достижений обрадуются (или нет), так как их легко заполучить.

Ну вот в принципе и всё. Для инди - неплохо. 6 бесполезных прыжков из 10

В ChromaGun вам предстоит выступить в роли тестера современной пушки ChromaGun. С ее помощью вам необходимо будет решать головоломки внутри специально созданных тестовых камер.
 
HarukiNo
395 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2016
This game was not too bad, but I wanted to give a negative review to warn about a couple of things people should know. (I am running on Linux):

- You can't reconfigure the key assignments. For 99% of you that's not a problem. For the few that don't use the standard keys it can be a deal breaker.

- You can't tweak graphics advanced. That's fine, I might not allow it if I wrote a game myself (to avoid the support headache). But you can't enable frame sync and my graphics have distracting shearing and other distortions as a result.

- The play concept seems fun, but the graphics quality themselves is poor and, in spite of what I read in other reviews, I thought the writing for the voice over was a painfully not-funny amateur attempt at Portal 2 like humor. I couldn't judge how good the voice itself was because the material was so bad that nothing could have saved it.

- You'll notice I don't have much play time. The first time a robot killed me I crashed and dropped out of the program. Along with the other issues it wasn't worth it to me to try again and risk crashing all the time. I just bailed and wrote this review mostly to warn people about the keys.

Velldanas
1,249 produits enregistrés
0
16 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 février 2016
NOTE: This game was given to me by the developer for review purposes. This did not influence my review in any way.

==========================================================
---------------------------------------OVERVIEW-------------------------------------
==========================================================
ChromaGun is a puzzle game with first-person shooter mechanics. The concept of the game is simple: use your paint gun to paint walls and droids to open doors and escape each level. But, especially in later levels, some of the puzzles are quite devious. It will take a bit of brainpower and some nimble droid dodging to make your way to the end.

==========================================================
----------------------------------------QUALITY-------------------------------------
==========================================================
Graphics - The graphics are large and colourful. Droids are suitably mechanical spheres hovering on small booster rockets, and it's easy to see which ones are dangerous and which are not from a quick glance. Given that the main idea behind the game is colour matching, it's obviously important for you to be able to quickly see the difference between the different coloured wall panels and droids. For the most part, the game handles this well, although in a couple of cases a droid in shadow was actually not the colour I first thought.

Graphics settings are pretty limited, but appropriate: a pre-game dialog box allows you to choose graphic detail (low, medium, high) and resolution, as well as whether you want windowed mode or full screen.

Sound - Sound is mostly pretty minimal. The game has some fairly forgettable background music, and the *pew,pew* and *bzzt* sounds of your chromagun and electric tiles, respectively, are okay, but nothing special. The voiceover of your supervisor / tormentor is very well done indeed.

Gameplay - In typical puzzle game style, ChromaGun divides its offering into a large number of small levels, grouped into different areas. The areas themselves are fairly unimportant, though, as each level has much the same theme -- there are no different worlds or anything like that -- so it's really just a long list of levels to get through. You start the game as a contractor for ChromaTech, at the office to test the new ChromaGun, a three-colour paint gun capable of colouring certain wall tiles and some droids. Droids of a particular colour are attracted to wall tiles of that colour, you're told in the first level, and from that point on the game has you using your gun to colour wall tiles and droids in your efforts to make it through the testing facility. Switches are introduced early on, and later levels include much harder obstacles, such as droids that can kill you, electrified floor tiles, and automated wall cleaners that remove your paint within seconds of spraying it on.

It's important for a puzzle game that the player is able to quickly grasp the mechanics and interface, and be able to focus on solving the puzzles. ChromaGun does this well, with a very shallow learning curve in the first two areas leading into some downright tricky later levels in the later areas. I still haven't managed to finish the game: one particular level in area five is doing my head in at the moment!

==========================================================
-------------------------------------PROS & ♥♥♥♥------------------------------------
==========================================================
Pros:
+ Clean, colourful graphics suit the game well.
+ Voice over and associated humour is very well done. I've laughed out loud a few times while playing.
+ shallow learning curve makes sure you grasp the simplest ideas well before increasing complexity.
+ Steam achievements will keep you coming back for one more try, even when your rage meter is approaching the redline.

♥♥♥♥:
- The primary mechanic is simple, and the game doesn't offer a whole lot more than that. In the later levels it can get a bit repetitive.

==========================================================
--------------------------------------CONCLUSION-----------------------------------
==========================================================
ChromaGun is a well-made puzzle game with minor FPS components. It has high production values and a core mechanic that works, so it sticks to it.

7/10

For more recommendations by LL's Game Giveaways and Reviews on quality indie games or ones with high potential follow our group curations here!
 
genkipro

A puzzle game in the vein of the Portal series. If you're a pretty average gamer who doesn't have a particular interest in the game I don't think it mangages to be fun enough to overcome that so I can't reccommend it; but if you do enjoy puzzle games (especially if you enjoyed Portal) I think you'd enjoy this game and see it as worth the buy. I just wouldn't reccommend it to the average gamer.

SpaceX24
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 aout 2016
Se vi è piaciuto Portal, se avete amato GLaDOS e i suoi scleri, sicuramente non potete farvi scappare questo gioco. Esattamente come il gioco a cui è ispirato, ChromaGun è un puzzle game in prima persona in cui non dovrete far altro che risolvere semplici (inizialmente) enigmi e proseguire stanza dopo stanza.
Cos'ha di diverso? Vi posso dire cosa NON ha, la portal gun. La ChromaGun vi permetterà di sparare dei colori e di miscelarli tra loro (sì, i colori primari e secondari insomma.. all'asilo ci siamo stati tutti). Potrete sparare questi colori sia su alcune pareti che su delle sfere (talvolta incazzose e appuntite, che vi seguiranno fino alla morte se non le bloccate ♥♥♥ il giusto colore).

PRO
- Intuitivo e veloce
- Sarcasmo giusto
- Molto colorato (giustamente)
- C'è una Demo gratuita disponibile se volete provarlo

CONTRO
- Ci sono un sacco di sottotitoli e per chi ha difficoltà ♥♥♥ l'inglese (vista la mancanza della lingua italiana nel gioco) potrebbe sentirsi in difficoltà o perdersi gran parte del gioco
- Portal costa meno


The cake is NOT a lie~ ❤
 
Nep-Nep
3
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2019
Produit reçu gratuitement

Received this as part of my Curiosity box by Vsauce. Disappointed to be honest. The narrator of the game belittles you like you are a child constantly while the puzzles of the game are apparently made for such an audience. The levels are super easy and get really repetitive and boring. As others have said, the game is obviously trying to be the next Portal, but offers none of the charm and none of the good feeling when you solve a puzzle. You don't feel smart after you finish these tests, they are just too simple and don't strain you to come up with good ideas to solve them.

Haven't checked out the workshop, maybe the community is able to make better maps, but I have little faith. Might change review after I check those out.

2/10

Évaluation publiée le 19 janvier 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

I will complete this review properly after more time spent in the game.

First of all thank you very much to the kind folks at Pixel-Maniacs for a completely free copy, a rare kind gesture.

I was a little late trying the game out but I will give my initial thoughts.

I thought the colour mixing was a neat and interesting mechanic, although so far a lot of the puzzles seem overly simplistic. I will hold my thought on that as I probably need to play further into the game for more complexity.

I ended up stopping early because the announcer, or voiceover was very off putting and it is a shame because the game itself is pretty neat, but the voice was ruining the experience for me.

Unfortunately I cannot recommend the game due to this, also I am not sure if this game brings much to the table in terms of originality.

I gave an honest review, despite not wanting to be negative. Perhaps my opinion will change when I play it further
 
Cheekyman
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Just got this for review, because it's free doesn't change my views!

First of all, LOVE this game's humor ! That is what hooked me, It reminds me of Portal, with the smartass GLADOS poking at you.

The puzzles seem very well designed, the controls are tight and precise, and the fact that traditonal FPS games have shift as "run" and spacebar as "jump" would lead you to believe that this game works in the same way.
It does not xD.
Jumping makes you do a useless hop, it's even an achievemnet, lol.
Running makes you go SLOWER lol/.
Add to the insanity of the Dev's updates page, (seriously, give it a read lol) These guys know what's funny, and made an awesome game to go along with it ^^
The fact they came up with a unique way for color blind ppl to play is nothign short of impressive, I hope this game gets alot more attention, these devs did such a good job with this game!
absolutely, 100% recommend this game.

2,769 produits enregistrés
