3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2023
Spyware Warning![en.wikipedia.org]This mobile app acts as spyware and performs personal data gathering and transmission. There's no way to opt out. This is completely unethical and reprehensible. Gamers must be aware of the dangers of installing this harmful software and should avoid this completely.


ChromaGun is a mobile app that's been dumped on Steam as if it was a real PC game (it's not)... it's a spyware riddled cash grab from greedy mobile devs. This mobile app is a somewhat lazy ripoff of real games like Portal and Q.U.B.E, but you just shoot a gun to change the colour of things, which causes things to move around a bit. So basically instead of picking up the box and putting it on the weight switch, you have to shoot the wall nearby to make something move onto it. Incredible innovation here, and props to completely ripping off Q.U.B.E's colour scheme down to the RGB swatches. No effort spared for this mobile app spyware.

From a technical perspective, as a mobile app, this doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The mobile app features lazy minimalist/untextured low-polygon "retro" assets and visuals, making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the early 1990s. The lack of textures is a method that lazy devs often use to disguise their lack of talent/interest in doing the graphics properly and trying to disguise it under the name of "art", or "We made it look bad on purpose", which really isn't something gamers should have to put up with. It's unclear why the developers weren't willing to arrange high quality, high polygon count contemporary assets and high resolution textures for the mobile app. It looks bad as a result of their decisions, and that's just another reason to avoid it.

Because this is a mobile app, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies. Compromises were made to cater to the iPhones that the mobile app was designed for. These are unfortunate handicaps and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was an afterthought for the iPhone developers who are to blame for this. The mobile app is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for mobile phones forces upon a game. Once more, mobile devs have made gaming worse for everyone. I didn't spend thousands on building a gaming rig just so I could pretend it's an iPhone.

These technical defects push this mobile app below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this mobile app was with players reveals a surprise... there's an almost (but not quite) healthy spike in player counts for the mobile app. But this only appears around the same time that trading cards were applied to the mobile app... so this is just card idlers getting their cards and moving on. A closer look at the numbers shows the mobile app just has a couple of players every week running up the mobile app and idling it for cards, then deleting it. We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many mobile apps like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

You're forced to sign a highly questionable yet legally unenforceable End User License Agreement. This agreement includes questionable (and possibly law breaching) privacy requirements that no gamer should ever have to engage in, primarily to enforce compliance with the spyware they try to use this mobile app to trojan your PC with. Developers must learn they are here to serve gamers, not control them or spy on them.

As mentioned in the EULA, this mobile app behaves as spyware and collects "telemetry" and personally identifying information. There is no apparent way to prevent this hostile and sinister privacy invasion. The developers will make the unverifiable claim that this data isn't personally identifying, of course that's BS as they're collecting IPs and all kinds of other information about gamers, when combined with other profiling data this can 100% identify an individual. They say it's for "QA" purposes but there's no guarantee they're not profiling you or selling your data to third parties as they spy on you. Should you trust them? Of course not... if they had any concerns about user safety and privacy, they wouldn't have built spyware into their mobile app with no way to disable it! There's simply no reason to trust them and gamers should avoid this mobile app because of this unacceptable privacy invasion.

Once more we see greedy mobile devs trying to scam PC gamers. On Steam, this spyware costs $13 USD, on app stores, it's free. Mobile devs must learn PC gamers are not here to be gouged, and can't be expected to pay THIRTEEN BUCKS FOR A FREE MOBILE APP just because it's been lazily dumped on Steam. This is unacceptable disrespect for PC gamers. Because this can be played free elsewhere, and because of the other defects, it's impossible to recommend. If you really want to be spied on, you can be spied on for free elsewhere without having to pay money for the experience on Steam.

Who do they think we are?
 
Obey the Fist!

Évaluation publiée le 5 avril 2022
5/10 story wise its like they stole a plot chunk of portal and use some of the same exact dialogue. not a deal breaker for me, but it bugs me.
+music is decent
+ steam workshop
what is a deal breaker is the fact that you cant wipe/repaint walls and almost every puzzle has you running from something well trying to paint a wall. oops you used the wrong color of the three time to reset the floor and some of them are long.
i love puzzle games, i hate when they have you solve the same thing over and over because you messed up a tiny thing at the end of the level that has nothing to do with the start. im 7 rooms away now and i painted the wrong color by mistake knowing full well that wasnt the color i wanted but i was trying to not get killed by a ball. time to reset EVERYTHING!!!!

Ich habe dieses schöne Spiel, 2016 vom lieben Ben von den Pixel Maniacs On-Stream geschenkt bekommen.
Das Game gefällt mir sehr und auch wenn die Rezension hier 7 Jahre zu spät ist, hab ich es genossen.

Nach langer Inaktivität, und auch dem durchsuchen meiner Bibliothek, bin ich dennoch wieder über dieses tolle Rätselspiel gestolpert und wollte nocheinmal anmerken, das es echt Spaß macht, und ich es Empfehlen kann.

Liebe Grüße

GG | Chris

I bought this cos I was looking for similar games to portal, but didn't realise what I enjoyed most about portal is the humour and the slickness of the game. this doesn't have any of the same polish. the puzzles are alright but the story/narration is negligible - also all the doors are unsettlingly thin. overall it's a fairly average puzzle game and I wasn't motivated to finish it.

Évaluation publiée le 3 septembre 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

I must say that I'm quite disappointed.

At first, I'd like to mention the general idea of the game and the creativity of the puzzles that were oftentimes fun to play through. But what really killed the experience for me was the general shortness, the achivements only worked 50% of the time and the game generally felt low quality most of the time. Like 90% of the assets were ripped from a free asset pack. But well, I'm in no position to judge a small indie game dev team in 2016.

I'd recommend the game if you want a short puzzle experience without a huge focus on story.

Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2023
- takes obvious inspiration from portal
- puzzles aren't super hard, but it's very easy to put yourself in a situation where you have to restart the entire level if you're like me and like to experiment with things. also i'm pretty sure i cheesed multiple puzzles but ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
- story could've been more interesting but there was less narration than i would've liked (this is where the portal inspiration is especially prominent. the story feels like a watered-down version of portal's story, and the narrator feels like a watered-down version of glad0s)

buy it on sale if you want to
 
Slaire
53 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 aout 2023
Ta gra nie wydaje się dokończona. Owszem, mechaniki działają bardzo dobrze, pathfinding dronów, np., wbrew moim obawom okazał się bardzo dobry i dostosowany do charakteru zagadek, z jakimi może się nam przyjść mierzyć, ale tyle aspektów tej gry jest niedokończonych, że po prostu nie mogę postawić oceny pozytywnej (nie są one wielkimi spoilerami, ale na wszelki wypadek i tak je oznaczam). Twórcy starają się wprowadzić fabułę, ale jedyne, co robią, to opowiadają nam parę żartów a 'la Aperture Science, co, moim zdaniem, jest absolutnym dnem. Jeżeli nie masz pomysłu na fabułę, ale masz pomysł na grę logiczną, po prostu zrób grę logiczną! Problem w tym, że zagadki też są zaprojektowane miernie. Pierwsza część gry to praktycznie ten sam ciąg przeciągania dronów przez poziomy, praktycznie nie używając logicznego myślenia, z małymi przerwami przy wprowadzaniu nowych mechanik, które i tak później pojawiają się jedynie sporadycznie. Dodatkowo twórcy mają czelność przedłużać je przez użycie pustych korytarzy i już przez nas poznanych zagadek jako fillerów. Nie tak powinna wyglądać gra logiczna! W dobrze zrobionej grze logicznej kolejne mechaniki są wprowadzane po tym, jak gracz poznał już dokładnie działanie poprzednich i jest gotowy na więcej. Następnie mechaniki te mogą zostać użyte do stworzenia nowych zagadek lub wariacji poprzednich. Tymczasem ChromaGun używa nowej mechaniki w jednym poziomie, by później błyskawicznie o niej zapomnieć i zaledwie dwa poziomy później ukazać nam poziom złożony w dwóch trzecich z zagadek zawartych w poziomie, który mijaliśmy pół godziny temu, równocześnie ucząc nas na ekranie (który pojawia się przed wejściem do każdego nowego poziomu) o mechanice, która nie pojawi się jeszcze przez kilka poziomów. Całe szczęście druga część gry jest już lepsza: poziomy stają się bardziej rozbudowane i faktycznie wykorzystują logiczne myślenie. W grze napotykamy również na dwa wyzwania, w których musimy pokonać poziom w wyznaczonym czasie, i za nic nie da się ich zrobić za pierwszym podejściem. W takich wypadkach owszem, nie należy dawać graczowi zbyt dużo czasu, ale przy marginesie zaledwie kilku sekund poziom staje się pamięciówką. W wielu miejscach brakuje również sposobu na to, żeby naprawić swoje błędy, i trzeba restartować cały poziom, i chociaż zgadzam się, że w grach logicznych nie można po prostu grać "na czuja", przy niektórych dłuższych poziomach staje się to przesadą. Ostatnim niedociągnięciem, o którym chciałbym wspomnieć, jest to, że nie otrzymujemy wystarczającego feedbacku na temat tego, jakiego koloru akurat używamy. Kilkakrotnie chwytałem się na tym, że nie zauważałem, że wybrałem zły kolor, i musiałem przez to powtarzać cały poziom, ponieważ np. zamiast fioletowego pomalowałem ścianę na pomarańczowo. Dla niektórych osób część z moich uwag może się wydawać nietrafiona, ale biorąc pod uwagę cenę gry, naprawdę nie możemy ustawiać poprzeczki aż tak nisko. 3-4/10

Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2023
ChromaGun is a clever well-put-together Portal-like with the main gampley focused on painting walls to direct hoverbots. It's roughly on par with Portal for the physical skills needed - it lacks the heights and flings but painting walls while dodging does require some coordination - and unlike many other Portal-likes, it is jank-free.

Overall, a bit short, but a well-polished and enjoyable game.

Could have been great to have an option to enable a "Clear" paint to make game more accessible but that's maybe a thing if they ever make another puzzle game.

Saalby
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2022
Chromagun is a fun little portal clone that executes its gimmick well. It's very basic in terms of gameplay and difficulty, so it's great for new gamers but not terribly interesting to anyone more experienced. Because it's quite short (2-3 hours), the base price of $13 isn't even worth considering, but it's worth the price with a good sale of 70-80%.

I found the puzzles too easy for the most part and only really had to think at a few points. However, that, along with the game's simple mechanics, makes this game great for younger people or people new to puzzle games. This game would be a great stepping stone for people who want to try out gaming but aren't quite ready for Portal.

For anyone with more experience in gaming, especially if you've already played Portal, I can't recommend this. Primarily because this game takes way too much influence from the Portal games. It was so much like Portal that most of the time, I was just thinking about how I'd rather play that. The ending is also a rip-off of Portal's but somehow lackluster at the same time.

Rating:
7 terrible Cave Johnson impersonations out of 10.

*Key received from the curiosity box.
 
TechTosser

🔲 Don‘t look too long at it

🔲 Very good
☑️ Good

🔲 Just don't

🔲 Just press 'W'
🔲 Easy
☑️ Significant brain usage
🔲 Easy to learn / Hard to master
🔲 Difficult
🔲 Dark Souls

⛏️ Grind ⛏️
🔲 Nothing to grind
☑️ Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks
🔲 Isnt necessary to progress
🔲 Average grind level
🔲 Too much grind
🔲 You‘ll need a second live for grinding

👨‍👨‍👦 Audience 👨‍👨‍👦
🔲 Kids

☑️ All

🔲 Very good

☑️ Bad
🔲 I'm now deaf

👾 Bugs 👾
🔲 Never heard of
☑️ Minor bugs
🔲 Can get annoying
🔲 ARK: Survival Evolved
🔲 The game itself is a big terrarium for bugs

📖 Story 📖

☑️ Some lore
🔲 Average
🔲 Good
🔲 Lovely
🔲 It‘ll replace your life

🕓 Game time / Length 🕓
☑️ Long enough for a cup of coffee (0 - 2 hours)
☑️ Short (3 - 7 hours)
🔲 Average (8 - 20 hours)
🔲 Long (21-60 hours)
🔲 Very Long (61-100 hours)
🔲 To infinity and beyond (100+ hours)

💰 Price / Quality 💰
🔲 It’s free!
🔲 Worth the price
☑️ If u have some spare money left
🔲 Not recommended
🔲 You could also just burn your money

💬 Comments 💬
Short Game Description
ChromaGun is a portal inspired game, where instead of using portals to solve puzzles, we use colors.
  • Positives
    Talking about the positives aspects of the game, first, the game is quite entertaining at the same time as challenging. Lastly, the game presents gradually different mechanics making it eventually harder the game.

  • Negatives
    On the side of negatives, first of all, the graphics are simple that at first glance it doesn't look bad, but jaggies are pretty notorious. Secondly, if you fail in some levels, you have to start at the beginning of that level, becoming in some hard levels really annoying. Finally, the game music, it's the typical non-copyright music, that makes the game a bit less original.
Conclusion
In conclusion, the game is fun to enjoy for a while, but it's nothing special. The game is a 6,25/10.
 
Vector99

Non recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

This isn't a bad game. It does what it sets out to do pretty decently. What does it set out to do? Give you an experience that is similar to Portal. That's what it is and nothing else. If you really are looking for some puzzle solving and want to get your brain working and you've already played Portal. Sure, give this game a go. But if you're like me and have a big backlog of amazing games to play, this one is better off being skipped.
(But I will still say, thank you Chrome for gifting me this)

xNEAT
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2022
Cool game! Sure, it reminds you of Portal. But I like that: a shooter-like puzzle game with a tad of a dark story. A major difference here is that you have dynamic enemies: you often have to flee and be quick, which makes the game quite exciting. Furthermore, the game looks nice and the music is relaxing. The only downside is that if you make a mistake, you probably have to restart the entire level.
 
betaxj9
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 mars 2022
I received this game through the Curiosity Box subscription service and didn't know anything about it before them. If you're looking for something at the same level as Portal, this may not meet your standards, but if you look at it as inspired by the Portal series, I think its a good game.
The puzzles keep you thinking, so that its not too easy to blast through. Some are frustrating (and ill admit I refereed to a guide on some) but I don't think that is a huge downside for me. I'd rather get stumped than fly through it without having any challenge.
I think the dialog can be a bit cheesy at times, but It doesn't deter me from the game.

Go in with an open mind. I think comparing it too much can be too hard on it. As a stand alone game, I think its good.
 
QueerKid

Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 février 2022
прикольный аналог портала
проходится за 3+ часа
задания простые, как по мне. для фанатов аналогичных игр будет казаться примитивным.
головоломки состоят в том, что ты должен окрашивать определенные панели на стенах (не все доступны для покраски), чтобы к ним притягивало дронов конкретных цветов (желтый к желтому и тд).
особенность в том, что цвета можно смешивать. если поверх желтой стены налить синей краски, панель станет зеленой.
механика интересная. не жалею, что купил.
раздражают подгрузки после каждого уровня. и ты вынужден делать принудительный рестарт уровня, если понял, что его не пройти после "гибели" какого-то из дронов или случайно испорченной панели. игра не подсказывает, что теперь пройти уровень невозможно.
в целом неплохая игра как аналог.

4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 décembre 2021
ChromaGun é um jogo bastante inspirado em Portal (uma homenagem, na verdade) com vários pontos cômicos, e uma jogabilidade bem interessante.

No lugar de disparar portais, você tem uma arma que dispara tintas nas três cores primárias (vermelho, amarelo e azul), e deve usá-las para passar pelos quebra-cabeças.

É um jogo curto, mas valeu a pena, bem divertido!

0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2021
The game is pretty good, interesting puzzle mechanics and some comical writing. If you're a fan of Portal, you might like this.

My one BIG problem with this game is: Unless I'm missing something as I'm still early on, you can easily completely screw up almost all puzzles causing you to have to restart. Accidentally shoot a colour somewhere it shouldn't be? You have to restart.
There should be some sort of way to either clean or re-colour the objects, it gets very frustrating and was a poor design decision.
 
Jenova
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Отлична игра в стиле портал. Помогает расшевелить мозг, особенно интересны карты, где прохождение идет на время. Суть игры в том, чтобы раскрашивать стены и летающие сферы, при помои краско-пистолета в три основных цвета (желтый, синий, красный), и в три цвета получающихся комбинированием по два цвета (синий+желтый=зеленый, красный+желтый=оранжевый, красный+синий=фиолетовый). Действие выполняют сферы, которые перемещаются к соответствующему цвету в который окрашены сами (сферы так же можно окрашивать). Забыл упомянуть про нейтральный, серый цвет, который получается при смешивании трёх цветов. Игра очень увлекательная, прошел ее на одном дыхании. К ресурсам компьютера не требовательна. Однозначно рекомендую.
 
me4enyi

52.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2021
Excelente juego de puzzles que ademas tiene workshop. Hacer niveles es fácil ♥♥♥ el level editor. Yo hice unos cuantos.
El juego en si tiene una historia aceptable, gráficos bonitos, mecánicas simples. No intenta ser una copia de portal, sino que tiene personalidad propia. Compatible ♥♥♥ joysitick y ademas tiene un workshop mas o menos activo.
El precio actual esta muy elevado, yo recuerdo haberlo comprado a menos de un dolar y en oferta.
Lo recomiendo si le bajan el precio. Los niveles son muy buenos, y hay muchos objetos ♥♥♥ los que interactuar, interruptores, puertas, paredes, esferas locas, etc...

9.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2021
I think high quality indie puzzle games are pretty much my whole thing now. I really enjoy this game. The puzzles are well put together and the color mechanic is a great touch; if you're like me though, who can't remember what colors come from what to save his life, you'll want to keep a color wheel chart near you when playing.

My only criticism is the premise: you're in a testing chamber run by good natured jerk, same as Portal. That's an overdone story IMO, but I play puzzle games for the puzzles, not the story.

Merim
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 février 2021
Simple, pero lindo juego de ingenio del 13 de Septiembre del 2015, que gira en torno al uso de colores. A través de un dispositivo que dispara pintura (ChromaGun), podemos colorear paredes, y robots esféricos flotantes (Worker Droids), que se sienten atraídos por las paredes del mismo color y se moverán hacia ellas. Los colores son primarios (rojo, azul y amarillo), y las mezclas (verde, morado y naranja). Mezclar más de dos colores diferentes dará como resultado el negro, que no atrae droides.
Nuestro objetivo es resolver acertijos reorganizando hábilmente los droides, cambiando sus colores y guiándolos hacia los activadores de apertura de puertas, interruptores o mosaicos electrificados.
Hay 26 niveles en total, de rompecabezas cortos para resolver cada uno ♥♥♥ una única solución; sin embargo, un solo error puede hacer que un rompecabezas sea irresoluble, obligando a reiniciar el nivel. Muy bueno para agilizar la mente!
 
hernaneugenio
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 novembre 2020
As with most Portal clones, it doesn't get close to the original. This one, like most others, is half baked. The levels chould have used a few redesigns, a few leveles should have been cut outright and frankly the narator and story should have either been scrapped or should have been present thoughout the game.

That all being said, as a first person puzzle game it's alright. It's not great, but it isn't bad either. And it is above mediocre. Now, if that actually makes it good or non will depend on you. Personally, I'd say it's worth it, at least discounted, if not at full price.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 octobre 2020
10점 만점에 6점.
재미있게 해서 추천을 주긴 하지만, 그렇다고 엄청 재미있는 수준은 절대 아니다. 별다른 스토리와 그래픽 요소가 없는 일반적인 퍼즐 게임.

“색상”을 소재로 퍼즐을 구성한건 상당히 신선하다. 일상 생활에서는 흰색을 보기 힘들지만, 반대로 이 게임에서는 의도적으로 흰색 배경을 선택해 색상을 강조한다.


하지만 문제는, 신선한 부분은 딱 거기까지 뿐이며, 후반으로 갈수록 아이디어가 떨어지는게 너무 쉽게 보인다. 특히, 가장 짜증났던건 “그저 플레이 타임을 억지로 늘리려는” 의도가 너무 뻔히 보이는 것이다.

즉 신선하고 새로운 기믹이 계속 등장하던가, 아니면 같은 기믹을 다르게 배치해서 새로운 해법을 찾을 수 있어야 하는데, 이 게임에는 둘 다 보이지 않는다. 이전 스테이지의 같은 기믹과 같은 배치에 그저 거리만 벌려놓거나 개수만 늘려놓은 스테이지가 나타나며, 뜬금 없이 “미로”가 나타나기도 한다.



그러나, 그럼에도 불구하고 전체 플레이타임이 5시간을 넘지 않는다는게 함정.
 
에닉스Enigs
0

0
Non recommandé

Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2020
Юмор с убийственным отношением к персонажу-игроку, стерильная лаборатория с "глюками", испытания-эксперименты, белоснежное оружие необычного применения.

Всё это мы уже видели, причём в шикарном исполнении. Тут же спустя всего пару уровней начинается какая-то муть. Как минимум из-за смешения цветов без возможности отката.

В Steam есть клоны Portal и повеселее.

Beluga 2
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 aout 2020
The short version is, knock-off Portal with color-based puzzles instead of portal-based ones. Nowhere near as good as Portal, but not garbage either. Try it on sale.

To go into a bit more detail, the puzzles are based around you shooting paint to turn walls or floating ball droids red, yellow or blue, or hitting them with multiple colors to mix them and get purple, green or orange as well (and eventually black with all 3 primary colors used). Red droids are drawn to red walls, etc., and if you have, for example, a red wall on both sides of a room and a red droid in the middle, it will be pulled both ways and stay in the middle of the room. If you then put another red wall on one side, it will shift further toward that direction but still stay somewhere in between. You have to get different droids onto pressure plates to open different doors while avoiding obstacles.

It's a fine concept in and of itself, but I think it suffers a whole lot from the obvious comparisons to Portal (they even have a "the cake is a lie" joke, so it's not like it was an accident). Special science gun; faceless, voiceless protagonist; a white, sterile testing lab with cameras watching you go through it; a deadpan voice over the speakers directing you through the tests; even (and very minor spoilers that really don't matter here) them trying to burn you alive after you finish the tests. It's very obviously ripping off Portal in theme, even though the puzzles are a completely different type, so I think I would have liked it more if they had tried to make it its own thing rather than just copying everything Portal did only worse (just off the top of my head, they could have made it magic-based instead of science-based with a magic wand and different colors of fairies or something and set it in some ruins in the forest. Bam. Unique game people won't constantly be calling a rip-off).

The puzzles themselves are fairly fun and interesting. They start out (too) easy and slowly get more difficult, but, while mostly enjoyable, they never really do anything incredibly novel or exciting. There are also a few spots where I don't know if they were just trying to make the puzzles seem more complex, or if they messed up in their design and just accidentally made them really easy to solve without completely doing the puzzle as intended, but I would go through the puzzle and not even use half of the pressure pads or other things I could interact with. I really didn't like those, because I feel in a good, tight puzzle game, you should use every element of the puzzle. Even though I finished them, they made me feel like I didn't actually solve them.

Anyway, it's a decently entertaining, short first-person puzzle game that, if you can look past the blatant Portal rip-off-iness, is worth a play if it's on sale. I finished the game in two and a half hours (with one grindy achievement left that I might go back and get just to 100% it), and with buying it on sale for $2.60, that's right in line with how much I like to spend on games ($1/hour, with exceptions, of course, but in general). I definitely would not have been happy paying $13 for this. So if you find it on a good discount and enjoy this type of puzzle game, give it a shot.
 
Oahkery
1,249 produits enregistrés
0

0

Évaluation publiée le 30 mars 2020
Juego divertido, estilo Portal (♥♥♥ algún varias referencias al mismo) pero mucho más corto. Los niveles no siguen una progresión gradual de dificultad (o al menos, a mi no me lo pareció), y es fácil quedarse atascado, requiriendo un reinicio del nivel (las mecánicas de Portal evitan ese tipo de situaciones, pero aquí se dan).
Resumiendo, buen juego, que, pasándomelo al 100% (campaña y logros), me ha llevado 4 horas. Luego tiene añadidos para aumentar el tiempo de juego, pero no son la atracción principal.
El editor de mapas, junto ♥♥♥ los mapas realizados por la comunidad le puede añadir bastante entretenimiento

Impossibru
319 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

ChromaGun - 8/10 - Bom

Quando recebi o jogo e vi o nome ChromaGun pensava que seria um jogo de ação para atirar em todo mundo, mas não o jogo não chega nem perto disso.

Resumidamente, o jogo te dá uma pistola de cores que pinta alguns lugares de azul, vermelho, amarelo e as demais combinações entre elas.

O jogo é 90% estratégia e 10% ação e velocidade. É um puzzle em primeira pessoa. A variedade de desafios é impressionante.

Chegar na saída é uma sensação de alívia sensacional.

O jogo ainda tem um modo de criação de novas fases :)

Dicas para iniciantes:

1) As portas não se fecham se você estiver logo abaixo delas.

2) colorir uma bola durante o movimento faz com que ela pare de se mover ( se não tiver nenhuma parede com a nova cor ao redor)

3) As bolas com espinho que ficam paradas começam a te perseguir se você atirar nelas, use isso para ganhar tempo.

4) Pinte a parede com a cor da bola que te persegue e ela vai parar de te seguir.

5) Treine a mecânica de atração das paredes, isso vai salvar muitos replays no futuro.

Recebi esse jogo da desenvolvedora e gostei bastante e indico para quem gosta de jogos de estratégia, mas não tenho vontade de jogar novamente o modo história porque depois que você aprender as mecânicas de cada fase o processo fica mecânico.

Vale a pena, eu indico.

Obrigado por ler essa análise !

Conheça meu canal no Twitch:

https://www.twitch.tv/faraquito
 
Faraco Jogador
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2017
Excellent first person puzzle game that has the same vibes as Portal and Magrunner. Great voice acting, funny dialogued, perfect controls, and unique puzzle mechanics are few of the many positives. Gameplay consists of moving droids around the level to position them on pressure pads that open doors. You have the ability to paint walls/droids any color as droids get pulled towards walls of the same color. New elements are thrown into the mix to make chambers harder to solve in each chapter. Some puzzles are very challenging and clever but rewarding once solved. This game is a blast to play and also has a variety of community created maps. This game is a must buy for any puzzle enthusiasts. [10/10]
 
DarkChaos

ChromaGun ist ein gut gemachtes Rätselspiel, indem der Spieler mit Hilfe einer Farbpistole durch mehrere Räume gelangen muss. Diese Räume kann er aber nur passieren, wenn der durch das gezielte einsetzten und "mischen" von drei Farben die entsprechenden Türen öffnet. Der Stil und Humor des Spiels erinnert ein wenig an Portal.
Ein guter Titel für zwischendurch!

Professor Chops
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 janvier 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

É um jogo surpreendemente bom. Tem uma mecânica que dá muita corda pros desenvolvedores criarem diferentes tipos de Puzzles, e que, no geral, são bem divertidos e desafiadores. Cada capitulo muda o esquema dos Puzzles, dando variedade ao game. É surpreendentemente desafiador nos últimos níveis e fica (Acredite ou não) bem perto da qualidade de um Portal 2.

A única coisa que eu notei de ponto negativo foi que o narrador tenta MUITO ser a GlaDOS versão masculina, e embora em certos momentos ele seja divertido, em grande parte falta falas pra que ele não fique repetitivo ou enjoativo. Em certos momentos o roteiro que deram pro cara ler não ajudou também. Isso, obvio, pouco atrapalha o game, mas vale citar porque você vai perceber isso ao jogar.

Platinado 100%. Excelente experiencia! Recomendadíssimo.

Obrigado pela Dev por me mandar o game, sorry por não poder gravar pro canal... D=
 
Kirby
499 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 décembre 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Ich habe ChromaGun nach einem kurzen Gespräch mit den Entwicklern auf der gamescom kostenlos erhalten.

Auf den ersten Blick erinnert das Spiel ein wenig an Portal, auch hier befinden wir uns in einer Testeinrichtung, halten eine Waffe in der Hand, die nicht zum Erschießen von Gegnern gedacht ist, und müssen Rätsel lösen um zum nächsten Raum zu gelangen.

Dabei ist ChromaGun keineswegs ein Portal-Klon, sondern schafft es, vollständig auf eigenen Beinen zu stehen. Die Spielmechanik ist in ihren Grundzügen so simpel, wie sie später im Spielverlauf auch fordern kann. Dabei ist das Spiel stets fair und es lässt sich immer nachvollziehen, woran man gerade gescheitert ist.

Technisch ist das Spiel gut gemacht, ich bin auf keine störenden Bugs gestoßen, die Grafik ist durchschnittlich, aber nicht schlecht.

Der einzige Kritikpunkt, den ich habe, ist der Umfang, nach etwa 3 Stunden hatte ich das Spiel durch. Hier wäre zum Beispiel ein Leveleditor mit Workshopintegration wünschenswert, sodass durch die Community immer wieder neue Levels erstellt werden können.

Ich kann ChromaGun aber in jedem Fall uneingeschränkt zum Kauf empfehlen.
 
MrFreaktal
512 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

This game is awesome! It's like Portal, except with colors, and without portals. This game is a great puzzle game. I love the final chapter and the satisfaction of completing the last level. Keep up the good work!

Als ich das Game zum 1. Mal spielte war ich beeindruckt , wie "anders" Portal sein kann. Man erkennt sofort, das Portal Inspirationsquelle war aber Chromagun ist völlig anders. Persönlich fand ich die meisten Räume zwar überraschend leicht aber jeder Raum ist unterschiedlich gestaltet. Und das Schöne ist, das das Spiel immer noch nicht als fertig angesehen wird sondern weiter mit Updates versorgt wird.

4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Chroma Gun is the FPS for people who can't play FPS. The few moments of "oh my God, faster, FASTER" are just enough to feel accomplished when successful, but not so frequent that you feel overwhelmed by the technical aspects. The story is basically non-existant, and that's o.k. The puzzles will keep your head scratching and then when you've solved them all, going back and speed running the entire game keep you engaged for even longer. There are some frustrating moments, certainly, but it's all from the trial and error nature of the game. Once you learn: it's great!

Full disclosure: I received a review copy of this game from Pixel Maniacs. The review itself is mine and they had no influence on its outcome.
 
PurpleFrog

0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

ChromaGun é um jogo de Quebra-Cabeça em Primeira Pessoa lançado em 16 de Fevereiro de 2016 pela Pixel Maniacs, desenvolvedora independente que é da cidade de Nuremberg na Alemanha. Apesar do jogo ser comparado principalmente à Portal, a única real coincidência é que aqui também estamos em uma fábrica fazendo testes de uma arma, mas a sua funcionalidade e a maneira como progredimos é totalmente diferente.

Iniciamos o jogo na porta da frente de uma das várias fábricas da ChromaTec, uma empresa cujas razões verdadeiras obviamente não são reveladas de início mas sabemos que eles estão testando essa nova arma, chamada simplesmente de "ChromaGun" para trabalhar em conjunto com o seu principal produto no mercado, os "WorkerDroids". Não é esclarecido também a função verdadeira desses dróides, mas se sabe que há 2 tipos: não-letal e letal.

O objetivo do jogo é simples: são 8 capítulos, divididos em 7 fases cada, sendo que o último são apenas 6. Cada fase, é um quebra-cabeça diferente que deve ser resolvido através da 3 cores da ChromaGun (Azul, Vermelho e Amarelo) que podem ser combinadas para fazer cores secundárias (Laranja, Roxo e Verde). Os dróides também tem essas cores e justamente ai que entra a mecânica do jogo: pintar paredes e o chão para fazer com que eles fiquem em cima dos controladores que abrem as portas e você avance para a próxima fase. Simples e direto assim.

As situações são das mais diversas possíveis e a única coisa que realmente incomoda é que as vezes o nível do desafio sobre abruptamente de uma hora para a outra e depois cai bastante novamente, sem nenhuma explicação aparente. Não é o suficiente para desistir do jogo, que além de ter essa grande variedade de quebra-cabeças, apesar de ter apenas 3 músicas disponíveis elas são muito bem produzidas e não enjoam mesmo depois de 6 horas de jogo.

Exatamente na metade do jogo, é esboçado um pouco de inserção de uma história um pouco mais trabalhada para entender um pouco mais sobre a ChromaTec e o personagem que estamos controlando, porém eles perderam essa oportunidade ao deixar isso passar batido nos capítulos subsequentes e se você espera por alguma conclusão pode ficar longe do jogo porque esse é daqueles finais que pode irritar se você procura por isso.

O jogo foi lançado no Steam através do Steam Greenlight e está disponível para Windows e Mac por R$25,99 (U$9.99). O jogo trás 22 Conquistas para serem desbloqueadas, das quais nenhuma ♥♥♥♥ nada ridicularmente difícil ou que estrague a experiência tentando faze-las, é compatível com controles como o do Xbox One/360, tem modo de Realidade Virtual compatível com Oculus Rift, cartas colecionais e tem também legendas em português.

Honestamente, esse jogo foi a maior surpresa que joguei esse ano e acabei jogando por acaso, pois a empresa enviou uma chave de ativação do mesmo para o meu canal no YouTube e eu acabei gostando de verdade do jogo. Claro que o acabamento e o produto final não pode ser comparado à um título AAA como Portal, mas considero que o que foi feito aqui é muito bom se levando em conta a pequena equipe que produziu e caso esteja curioso para conhecer o jogo e esteja sem dinheiro há uma demonstração gratuita do jogo aqui no Steam
 
UsoppBR
493 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 septembre 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Игра довольно радует по стороне головоломки. Она рассчитано по шаговыми головоломками для разогрева котелка, как начиная с самых легких до более так сказать тяжелых. Не просто сочетании парочки цветов, а правильное обмозгованное передвижение шаров, не считая препятствии которые не дадут Вам так просто открыть следующий уровень. Предназначено не только для детей, так как и для взрослого это не окажется таким уж простым. Атмосфера состоит только из белых стен, на которых мы можем выразить свои эмоции)) Ах да кстати в игре можно прыгать, забавно что он не просто прыгает как 4-х летний ребенок, а то что и ничего не нужно перепрыгивать (разве что попытаться перепрыгнуть свои же шаги :D). Особого захватывающего сюжета нету, да и думаю для такой игры она без надобности. Музыку как по мне разрабы подобрали как раз спокойные композиции, подходящие для размышлении. Во время записи полутора часового геймплея НИ ОДНОГО БАГА НЕ ОБНАРУЖИЛ!!! На данный момент для меня не удобством показалось мелочь звуки эффектов выстрелов и т.д., которыми являются резки прервыв звука. То есть звуки не имеют затухание в конце, но как я и сказал это НЕ ТАК ВАЖНО (ведь параллельно играющей с музыкой этого не заметно). Жаль нету полного русского перевода, хотя бы меню и субтитров)) Но если хотите принять вызов разработчиков можете смело проигнорировать все минусы, и показать что это будет для Вас слишком просто.
 
Woibai

Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2016
It follows a similar style to the paragon title of portal, but with it's own choice of puzzle mechanic. However, it fails to caputure the charm and creativity of it's insparation title. It's colour matching mechanic isn't fun, coming off as the slightly educated version of a slow game of Bop-it. The rooms are very flat and uninteresting to look at, and the intercom voice comes off as harsh rather than comidically savage. I can honestly say that this is one unrefundable game I wish I could return.

When i got my hands on it i went straight into venture, after passing few chapters it felt peace of cake (which i've found one in game literally!), then some work began, not that it ever became hard, but it wasn't that easy either, i liked alot it being well balanced.

  • Not repetitive puzzles

♥♥♥♥:
  • I felt the game could be longer

Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Was given this game by the CEO of the company, via Twitch messaging. Streamed it for about two hours, and got approximately halfway through the game (according to the in-game overhead dialogue).

Pros:
1: GREAT concept for a game!
2: Customizable controls (do it from the launcher, not from in-game!) I actually swapped Blue and Yellow (1 and 3), moved Zoom to F, and moved Sneak to LAlt.
3: Later puzzles REALLY make you think out the rooms you're in, and are no longer a cakewalk.
4: "Colorblind mode" uses symbols to show colors (didn't test it, not color-blind, but wanted to mention it DOES exist).

♥♥♥♥:
1: First few levels are almost TOO easy (I know, tutorials, but I'm usually a quick study on controls and gameplay).
2: I'd personally swap where the blue and the yellow tubes are on the gun. On the left side, it shows Yellow/Red/Blue, but looking at the gun, it's colored Blue/Red/Yellow. Kept hitting blue while looking for yellow, and vice versa.
3: Zero help in-game if you get stuck. Either reset or die, over and over and over again. (No, I don't want the game spoon-fed to me, but I have the patience of a three-year old in a candy store.)

The overhead dialogue somewhat reminds me of the Portal series, although a bit less degrading towards you. (Good? Bad? I'll let you decide.)

In summary, it's not normally the type of game I'd play (I'm more of an RPG guy), but this game was actually fun. I don't feel like playing this game was a waste of my time, and I would recommend it to others.
 
Vyc Ðarkshådøw
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

ChromaGun is an interesting game for me. And I personally have some mixed feelings about the whole package of the game. Let's start by breaking down my Pros and ♥♥♥♥.

So, for those of you deliberating whether to buy this game, I highly recommend it if you enjoy puzzle games such as Portal and others of that specific genre. It's a love letter to the game, containing a few hidden references for the player to find.

The Pros:

The useage of colours to solve the puzzles is a fresh new take on the puzzle genre and provides a fun four hour experience.

The game has eight chapters worth of chambers and almost every chapter has 7 stages tacked on, so you get a lot of gameplay for your money's worth.

The Narrator is entertaining... when he's around.

The droids.


The ♥♥♥♥:

After a while the six colours you can make become a little boring. By chapter 6, I was desiring a new upgrade. Maybe an option that could revive rusted objects perhaps?

The electric tiles and their hitboxes. If there's anything I disliked in this game, it's those electric tiles. I had my fair share of failures from them and they ruined my experience in the final room of the game as I kept getting shocked by them at the end due to the working droids pushing me into them (This is during an escape sequence where you really shouldn't die for maximum impact).

The lack of narration is some portions of the game. I couldn't help but feel like half of the chapters were just romps through the test chambers. We don't have as much interaction with the Narrator as I would have liked and I just couldn't care for the character when he talked. Sometimes I forgot he was there.

The end of Chapter 4. Because a few floors in to chapter 5 we completly ignore what had happened like it had never taken place.


Overall, I'd give this game a solid 7/10 with a recommendation to Buy it! The game works, caters to all audiences and is an easy fix for those with Portal withdrawel symptoms. But keep in mind the game doesn't have much of a story and sweeps any narrative portions under the rug fairly quickly.
 
Billy S

0

Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

First of all, Thank you to Pixel Maniacs for the oppurtunity to make me as one of of the lucky person to try out this game for free
Thank you so much

As for the game, nothing much to say
It is a simple puzzle game which involve around 3 primary colors which are RED, YELLOW and BLUE
The first 2 or 3 stages is simple but as the game progress, it will get more complex and you will die a lot ( at least for me xD).
Secondary Colors such as Green, Orange and Purple comes after you beat several levels. This is where you need to remember the combination that you learned in your Art Class back in the day.

The puzzle is very challenging but not too hard. You can figure out everything pretty much if you are well aware of your surrounding


You can easily driven into this game because as soon as beat one level, you want to play more and more and more.
The narrator in the game is pretty much like Stanley Parable but less annoying unless you die a lot xD.
Always read anything on the upper board before entering the level, it have useful tips.

As for the performance of the game, it runs at 60 fps almost perfectly throughout the game but drops to 30fps at some occasion (like when the fire and explosion event occur). That was not a problem for me.

The game deserve a solid 9/10 for the price and the content. I hope it will have a sequel with more workerdroids and tertiary colors.
I hate that brown workerdroids btw.

Thank you so much for the game, Pixels Maniac
The after party scene is well made, I love it!
 
safwan

Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

İnceleme + Video
Herkese merhaba. Bu videomuzda ChromaGun isimli oyunu beraber inceleyeceğiz. ChromaGun birincil şahıs bakış açısıyla oynanan bir puzzle oyunu. Oyunda amacımız droid denilen yuvarlak uçan nesneleri doğru konumlara getirerek yolumuza devam etmek ve içinde bulunduğumuz odadan diğer bir odaya geçmek. Henüz oyunun 2 bölümünü tamamlamamıza rağmen kafamızda oyuna dair birçok artı ve eksi özellik yer etti. Artılara değinmemiz gerekirse, bize göre oyunun en büyük artısı çözdüğünüz bir puzzle'ın diğer bir puzzle ile doğrudan ilişkisinin bulunması. Örneğin bir oda zincirindesiniz ve birbine farklı konumlardan bağlı 4 oda var. İlk odada kullandığınız droidi geri dönüp yanınıza getirerek son puzzle'ı çözmeniz gerekebiliyor. Oyun aynı zamanda sizi boşa uğraştırmak için elinden geleni yapıyor. Tamamen gereksiz ve o puzzle'da zerre kadar işinize yaramayacak bir ton obje koyarak sizin puzzle'ı nasıl çözeceğinizi anlamamanıza sebep oluyor.Oyunda bize bir de dış ses eşlik ediyor. Sesin esprili bir şekilde verdiği talimatlar ve ipuçlarıyla oyunu anlıyoruz. Kat geçişlerinde odaya girmeden önce sizi bir ekran karşılıyor ve size oyun içi mekanik vb konularla ilgili bilgiler veriyor. Bu da gözünüzden kaçan bir mekanik olma ihtimalini minimuma indiriyor. Son olarak oyunun yapımcılarının eklediği ufak gibi görünen ama çok büyük önem taşıyan bir özellikten bahsedelim. Oyuna renk körü modu eklenmiş ve bu mod sayesinde herbir rengin kendine özel bir sembolü var ve renk körleri oyunu renkler yerine bu sembollerle oynuyor. Oyunun eksilerine değinmemiz gerekirse oyunun puzzle'larını çözerken yanlış bir işlem yaptığınızda geri alamıyor ya da düzeltemiyorsunuz. Bu belki de oyunu daha zor bir hale getirmek için yapılmış bir eylem olabilir fakat hem bir süre sonra oyun şevkini kırıyor hem de boş yere vakit kaybetmemize sebep oluyor. Yanlış bir işlem yaptığınızda geri dönmek isterseniz son kontrol noktasından başlamak zorunda kalıyorsunuz. Oyunda kontrollere bakmamızı veya değiştirmemizi sağlayan bir ayarlar menüsü yok. Bu da benim aramış olduğum fakat bulamadığım bir unsur. Son olarak oyunun en büyük eksisi de tamamıyla Portal'ı anımsatan bir oyun olması. Grafikleri ve chroma silahı bize Portal'ı anımsattı. Bize yeni bir oyun oynuyormuş hissiyatından ziyade Portal serisinin yeni bir oyununu oynuyormuş hissiyatını verdi. Videomuza son vermeden önce oyunun yapımcıları olan PixelManiacs'ın diğer oyunlarına göz atmak için sağdaki linke ChromaGun'ın steam sayfasını görüntülemek için soldaki linke tıklayabilirsiniz. Kendinize iyi bakın. Hoşçakalın.

Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

This game is hilarious fun! With a snarky, cynical narrator with the stylings of GLaDoS and a similar voice to the Narrator from The Stanley Parable, this game is entertaining from the start!
The puzzles are heavily inspired by Portal, using little WorkerBots to be attracted by coloured walls and hover over spots that open doors and such. It's bloody fun, and nothing could ruin this game!
The only things I have to point out is how seemingly bland the test rooms are in chapters 1-2, and also the distinct lack of the Narrator after the tutorial.
Besides that, this game is wonderful! I'd heartily recommend it to anyone looking for a great puzzle game!
(Also, the Devs are very kind people. Do not be afraid to approach them with constructive criticism!)
 
•cC• K25
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

The game is great. if you liked the Portal games, you will like this. It has the creepily overjoyed sense of humor, the gameplay is interesting and intensive at times.

I will note that i am colorblind, i was notified that they had just added a colorblind mode to the game which uses symbols instead of colors. I am excited by the implementation, it makes the game a whole lot easier to play and understand the colors/how they mix together to get the desired effect. I got this game for free, but i have let my friends know about this game, as they are waiting for Portals 3 to come out, this will almost definitely satisfy their thirst for the gameplay experience.

Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

I would like to start off by saying Thank you to Pixel Maniacs for sending me a key to this game.
I overall enjoyed it, It's a family fun game...it does however have it's challenges. I found myself to be stuck at times.
Just like many others, it reminded me of Portal...yet it is still it's own idea.
I've played a couple hours, and have earned all the achievements, but I would still play it again. I wish it was a bit longer with more colors or challenges, but it's still an awesome game.
If you like puzzle games, you will find this entertaining!

Graphics are great, the game is locked at 60 FPS, but it runs very smooth and it looks great overall.

The music is nice and calming too, it goes well with this game.

Gameplay is what you would expect from a a game like this, but it's better. I used both my XBox one controller and my Mouse/keyboard and they both worked perfect, I found it easier to walk with the controller and aim with the mouse.

Overall, it's a fun game, has challenging puzzles, and for the first time...the cake isn't a lie.
 
TBBG

Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2016
Great Game! If you loved Portal, you will most likely love this!

This game is clearly inspired by Portal and also has a nice story narration accompanying the Riddles.

The Rooms/Riddles themselves always have to do with the Three colors and the game can be quite challenging, especially since it is still introducing new features almost near the end of the game.

And the Price is good too! You'll definitely have a fun time with this, and for the speedsters: This game also has a specific Speedrun mode :P

1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

So like many people here, I recieved the game for free. I'm the kind of guy who enjoys almost all kinds of games. I very much enjoyed the portal series, which this reminded me of. Although it is very different gameplay wise it does look some what similiar in terms of the style. It had a very elegant and smooth design, very sleek.

Gameplay wise it was enjoyable. Solving puzzles with colors by shooting at walls and/or a bunch or Mr Handy's from Fallout. In all seriousness it is a very nice idea and it was done very well. The puzzles were not very hard but it became a lot more fun with the very talented voice actor guiding you through it. The story seems to be fairly short though.
It can become slightly boring after a while, but that might just be me. That might be one of the very few ♥♥♥♥ of the game. But it has it's twists so it will keep you occupied for a few hours! It's fun while it lasts.
I did however recieve it for free. So I can't actually tell you from that perspective if you should buy it or not. But I did enjoy it. If you think you would too then go ahead and buy it!

And like most people here I do have a video. It's not a review but simple gameplay:

Produit reçu gratuitement

I was given this game for free by Pixel Maniacs as I was asked to stream this game for them and share with my community. I think this game is definitely worth getting as it has its similarities with Portal and Portal 2, but has more unique puzzles that really get you thinking. This game definitely needs to get more attention than it is getting right now, especially from those wanting Portal 3 to happen, I would say this is almost like a Portal Prequel or something similar, and it's one of the better Indie games that have been made. It does a fair job reflecting a strategy and puzzle based game, and I will defintely tell other friends and streamers to check out this game and maybe be able to help bring this game some light. Can't wait to play even more of this game!

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

As a small youtuber who will play just about anything, I was quite pleased to have gotten this in my inbox about a week ago. I expected a simple puzzle game, but the reality was far better than I expected. It's not the prettiest game on the block, but the really smart color puzzles that truly make you think out your order of operations won me over. There were a few rooms that took me a half dozen tries or more to get through. Remembering you can turn things brown to make them inert comes into play a few times as well. Then theres a few parts where you're chased by brown workerdroids... fun times. The narration is amusing, aiming to be in the vein of Portal 2, and isn't too obtrusive. I only had a couple times when I would be forced to restart a room and there would be a narration replayed at me.

My main quibble is that there isn't a way to unpaint a wall after you've messed up. Thankfully, the rooms that this can occur are generally pretty short and you've got all the time in the world - for the most part - to figure them out. A quick restart and you can try again.

I had a lot of fun with this one. Check it out.
 
Savrin

Fun puzzle game about combining colours with a colour gun to move objects and open doors.
Simplistic and mostly white surroundings as starting point of every level.
The puzzles aren't too hard, and with the exception of a few puzzles, it gives you time to think.
The timed puzzles were not my favourite, but all in all I enjoyed the game.

3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 juillet 2016
ChromaGun is a Puzzle Game with some parallels to Portal. You are walking around with a color gun and you can shoot three different colors: blue, yellow and red. You have to color walls and droids to make your way through the levels.

I enjoyed playing the game. It was fun. Sometimes challenging but alwaya managable. It took me about 3.8h to finish the game with all achievements.

I bought the game during the Steam Summer sale and I would totally recommend to buy this game in sale. If you do not mind the short play time I would even recommend to buy it if it is not in sale :)
 
Seven
1,031 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

ChromaGun instantly captures your attention with simple puzzles that become more tricky as each level progress. The concept is excellent, using your ChromaGun to paint wall panels different colours to attract the Worker Droids around the rooms to various pressure pads to open doors to new levels. This is a puzzle game at heart that makes you think sideways and pushes you to engage the brain cells. The realisation and achievement of progression is rewarding and the pace of difficulty is measured perfectly. The graphics are sharp and the colours vibrant as expected from @pixel_maniacs game studio. The sound is good and a special shout to the voice acting of John Sutton as the truly entertaining, sarcastic, funny and slightly crazy computer voice that accompanies you on this adventure. If you love puzzle games, you will love ChromaGun. Here is a link to Kal Dragon Gaming playing this really cool game -

Vidéo YouTube™: ChromaGun - Ep1 Puzzle Fun 
Vues : 29
We play ChromaGun, a fun puzzle game where you use paint colours to progress from room to room. ChromaGun by Pixel Maniacs is a first person puzzler about colors – you don't kill, you don't hurt...


Overall 5/5 Highly Recommended, Great Puzzler, Fun Game
 
kaldragon04
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2016
[Product received for free]

Quick review: Mostly positive

Good stuff / General information:
- Took me about 3hr 15m to finish the first time
- Clever puzzles involving getting objects to move to switches by attracting them with matching colors. It gets more complicated because you can paint the objects as well and not "unpaint" them. Also, mixing colors and objects with different behaviors.
- Heavy Portal inspiration, and not just because it's a first person puzzle game. It's in a testing facility and there's a funny narrator who doesn't have your best interest in mind.
- Has a speedrun mode, so that's nice.
- Good design that mostly teaches by showing and letting you discover for yourself rather than straight up telling you what to do.
- Multiple solutions sometimes.
- Decent music, though you probably won't notice it usually.

Less good stuff:
- There were probably only two puzzles that I felt were unfair because of key elements being obscured by walls/doors, requiring you to guess part of the solution. Maybe I was missing something, but I doubt it.
- Making a mistake often required that you restart the entire level, but that doesn't usually turn out to be so bad since you can redo it quickly once you know the solution.

My full playthrough is up here, but it'll spoil puzzles for you, so watch at your own risk:
Vidéo YouTube™: Let's play live: ChromaGun (Full Playthrough) [Spoilers] 
Vues : 33
I played through the entire game of ChromaGun without any hints or even knowing what the game was about. Turns out it's a First Person Puzzle game, and a pretty good one.

Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

--Received as a free copy from the devs for promotional purposes.--

From what I've played so far, I definitely recommend Chromagun. The game is very reminiscent to the Portal franchise while also setting itself apart greatly from it. It has interesting mechanics with a memorable gimic, and although it's not the most polished game in the world, I can say with all certainty that it IS worth paying for. My only complaint would be that the game seems a tad expensive for what it offers, but as I haven't played it all the way through yet, I can't judge this for certain. I would advise picking it up when it's on sale for now, but just pick it up, it's worth your time.

Évaluation publiée le 7 juillet 2016
At first glance, it looks like a rip-off of Portal, but it is a very fun game. There are a lot of similiarities, but the tech is different. You use the ChromaGun to paint walls and control WorkerDroids to do your bidding so that you can navigate through the increasingly difficult puzzles on each floor. Absolutely love this game! A must-have for Portal and puzzle game fan.

Ich war er bisschen abgeturnt, als ich das flackernde Licht und den Fahrstuhl, der sehr billig ausgesehen hatte, gesehen habe, auch die Abstürze oder das nciht funktionieren einiger achievements (für Chapter 1+2, für gekillt werden von nem droid und für abschissen von nem Droid hab ichs nciht bekommen),hatte aber trotzdem sehr viel Spass, die Rätsel sind cool und erinnern am Spiele wir Portal oder Quantum Conondrum, was ncihts schlechtes, sondern etwas gutes heissen soll. Recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juin 2016
Portal mit Farben... so könnte man das Spiel glaube ich am besten beschreiben. Wie in den Portalspielen sind auch hier ein paar zynische Kommentare der Stimme aus dem Off und gute Rätsel in das Spiel eingebaut.
Gespeichert wird automatisch, manuell speichern ist in diesem Spiel nicht möglich.
Einen Verbesserungsvorschlag gibt es von meiner Seite aus aber noch: Man könnte eine Lösch- oder Radierfarbe ergänzen. Ich hatte schon mehrmals die Situation, dass sich Wände nur noch braun färben ließen, die Drones einem nicht mehr folgen und man Schalter somit nicht mehr aktivieren kann. Insbesondere, wenn man dann in einem Raum ist, wo man sich nicht selbst umbringen kann, bleibt einem nichts anderes übrig, als die Testkammer neu zu starten.
...oder alternativ eben manuelles Speichern ergänzen, um dem vorzubeugen.
Auf der anderen Seite ist dies aber genau der Punkt, der den Schwierigkeitsgrad des Spiels anheben soll. Überlege also vorher, welche Wände du wie färben willst!
 
ChriSchan
77 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2016
I thoroughly enjoyed Chroma Gun, and I suspect anyone who likes first person puzzlers as much as me will find similar enjoyment. However it wasn’t a flawless experience.
The Good
  • Solving puzzles more often than not felt satisfying.

  • The puzzle design for the most part was well done and left me impressed.
The Adequate
  • The narrative is what you’d expect, from a disembodied GlaDOS-esque narrator. While I found a moment here and there humorous, the story was mostly benign merely acting as a vehicle for the puzzles.
The Bad
  • There were a few fast paced sequences that to me were more frustrating than fun or exciting; as well as a dark, flashlight section that was a bit straining on the eyes (for me anyway).

  • There are no colorblind options from what I could see. So if this is something that might affect you, it would be a good idea to watch some videos and see how well you can distinguish between the colors.
All and all I’m glad I made this purchase. I should mention that I bought this game at a sale price of $5.84 as opposed to the normal price of $12.99. That being said I think I would have still been satisfied.
 
Hobo_Crow
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juin 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Bonjour à tous voici une petite presentation rapide via la rediff de mon live sur twitch du jeu Chromagun.


Le jeu se laisse appréhender facilement. Les premieres enigmes sont relativement faciles. Fortement inspiré du type Portal, certains y trouveront leur compte.
Je lui repproche quand meme le fait qu'on enchaine les niveaux sans interruption ou interraction que ce soit. Pas de tableau de score ou autre.

Ceci dit le jeu mérite quand meme qu'on lui porte un certain interet.


Vidéo YouTube™: [Fr] [PC] Chromagun. Decouverte du jeu sur quelques niveaux. [@pixel_maniacs]

2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Chromagun is a definitely awesome game. I would say it's kinda portal like but only in the fact that you're using a gun and solving a puzzle room. Drones and colors are your tools to navigate through the maze of rooms. It starts out pretty easy and it's difficulty level progresses steadily as most puzzle games should. I played this game with an Xbox 360 controller and it worked pretty well. The use of drones in the game are pretty awesome but be careful not to color it wrong colors or it's game over. This Indie company is off to a great start I can't wait to see more.

Évaluation publiée le 25 mai 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Got a key for this game from the developers and wasn't actually expecting to have as much fun as I did. I have never really been a puzzle gamer, I prefer MOBAs and RPGs, but this game had a neat charm to it that I found kept me coming back for more. The game is challenging, sometimes frustratingly so, but makes you use your brain instead of just letting you autopilot. The mechanics are smooth, the visuals enticing, and the narrator delightfully sadistic. All in all good stuff, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun puzzle game.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mai 2016
Si toi aussi tu ronges ton frein en attendant Portal 3 (il n'est pas interdit de rêver, que je sache...), voici qui devrait t'occuper trois ou quatre heures. Encore que, pour être tout à fait honnête, Chromagun n'arrive pas à la cheville de son modèle. Ce qui n'en fait pas pour autant un mauvais jeu, bien au contraire ! Disons juste que les similitudes sont ni nombreuses que le terme "portal-like" ne pourrait être plus approprié pour le qualifier. Or, trop s'approcher d'un Portal, c'est s'exposer à la comparaison...

Commençons par l'histoire : vous vous trouvez dans un ascenceur, qui s'enfonce dans le complexe scientifique aseptisé d'une entreprise nommeé Chromatec. Depuis les haut-parleurs, une voix vous accueille, puis, après deux ou trois vannes, vous guide jusqu'aux premières salles de test. Bien entendu, dans la foulée, on vous refourgue une arme expérimentale qui permet de peindre certaines surfaces en jaune, en bleu ou en rouge ; avec chacune des combinaisons que cela implique. Autant vous dire que pour l'originalité, il faudra repasser.

Heureusement, le gameplay est intéressant, même si les habitués du genre ne feront des énigmes qu'une seule bouchée. Pour l'essentiel, le concept de Chromagun est basé sur l'attraction. Dans ces salles de test, vous rencontrerez des droïdes (éteints, en veille ou actifs) que vous pourrez peindre, du moins la plupart du temps. Un droïde vert sera ainsi attiré par des murs verts, le but étant de les disposer sur les interrupteurs qui commandent à l'ouverture des portes. Au fil de la progression s'y greffent quelques mécaniques supplémentaires : des dalles électrifiées, des écrans, par exemple.

En somme, Chromagun est un bon jeu, avec une réalisation très propre et un gameplay intéressant, qui peine cependant à se démarquer de la série dont il s'inspire. A faire si vous avez déjà terminé tous les classiques du genre.

Verdict : 3,5/5 - Ce qui est bien, mais pas top.
 
Berserkr
1,100 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

ChromaGun is a fantastic and fun entry to the 3D puzzle game genre. It plays in a way somewhat similar to Portal, but it has so many differences in game mechanics that I wouldn't call it a Portal copy by any definition. The story is somewhat short, so I wouldn't call it a perfect puzzle game. If a level editor is added along with steam workshop support, this would truly have potential to be an infinitely re-playable game.
 
GREAT_SALAD

Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2016
Definitely worth a shot if you enjoy puzzle games. I was worried it was going to be a Portal clone (puzzles, gun, testing facility, jerk narrator, robots, etc.) but besides the surface similarities I was pleasantly surprised. I feel like I'm two thirds of the way through, so I'm a little concerned about the size of the game and replayability - so, if it does end in three hours in, I don't think its worth the $14. At 50% off, definitelty worth it.

639 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 avril 2016
'ChromaGun' ist ein Spiel, das sich ziemlich an 'Portal' orientiert. Zwar hat 'ChromaGun' auf den ersten und zweiten Blick nicht so viele Möglichkeiten wie 'Portal', aber ab einem bestimmten Level habe ich schon einige Innovationen sehen können, die über das, was 'Portal' bietet, herausgeht.
Was ich kritisieren würde ist, das man, nach jedem erfolgreichen absolvieren eines Sublevels, eine Treppe nach oben zu gehen hat. Besser gefunden hätte ich es, wenn man nur, nach absolvieren eines gesamten Levels, eine Treppe nach oben geht. Das absolvieren eines Sublevels hätte man z.B. durch einen speziell hervorgehobenen Bereich kennzeichnen können.
Andererseits hätten sich die Entwickler tiefer über die Aufteilung der Räume innerhalb einer Ebene den Kopf zerbrechen müssen.
 
arbol01
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 avril 2016
After recieving an email from Pixel Maniacs to try out Chromagun on my Twitch stream ( twitch.tv/twisteedj ) and I thought why the hell not!? what did i have to lose? (This is a unbiased review!)

After a short time of playing this game i knew this would be a very addictive puzzle game!

In the game you need to use you're Chromagun to shoot different colours onto walls to attract the Workers (Big Spikey Balls) to bind onto the wall and over sensors to open the exit to gain access to the next level. but be careful if you shoot the workers and no colour is on the walls they chase you!. Sounds easy right? NOPE!

At times i would pull my hair out with frustration at my own mistakes and other times sit there with a massive grin on my face knowing i had solved a puzzle that took me about 10 minutes to figure out.

Its a beautiful game to look at and i know Pixel Maniacs have put a lot of time into this game!

I highly recommend this game 8/10 TwisteeDJ Approved!!
 
Twistee
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 avril 2016
I love this game! It's easy to figure out even though there's not a walkthrough tutorial and the levels have a great progression. The graphics are simple but I think it's an awesome style for a game like this! There are one or two little bugs where things will flicker but otherwise it's super-well built.

There's only one real problem and, unfortunately, it will prevent me from being able to play the game much. It made me seriously motion-sick. Within 2 hours of playing I had a pounding headache and my stomach was tying itself into knots.

If you don't suffer from things like motion sickness, though, definitely try out this game! It's just unique enough to be considerd 'compelling'.
 
LadyArcanist

Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 avril 2016
"Ironischer Rätselspaß der leider etwas kurz, dafür aber knackig und kompakt immer wieder überrascht."

Auch wenn man Chromagun anmerkt, dass es noch etwas roh wirkt und ein Erstlingswerk darstellt: Spaß macht das Ding auf alle Fälle! Die Rätsel sind klasse gestaltet und nutzen sich durch die nach und nach dazukommenden Elemente nie ab, und auch der Erzähler ist ein mieser Kerl, der mich aber trotzdem des Öfteren zum Lachen brachte. Das Fehlen einer großen Rahmenhandlung stellt für mich wohl das größte Manko dar…schon allein weil nach drei Stunden Spielzeit alles rum ist - nur noch einige geheime Erfolge gibt es für die Sammler herauszufinden. Noch mehr Elemente, eine tiefer greifende Geschichte, John Sutton als Erzähler wieder mit am Start und ich freue mich auf die Fortsetzung!

Full Review: http://playmoments.de/all-review-list/chromagun-bei-uns-im-test/
